original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten no //🔽de la sems can gyi 'jig rten yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /

translated: With regard to the first, the world of sentient beings, it is said:🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be limitless because the realm of sentient beings is limitless.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be immeasurable because the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be inconceivable because the realm of sentient beings is inconceivable.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be incomparable because the realm of sentient beings is incomparable.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs @207a * //🔽su smin par byas pa'i sems can ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te / bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs @207a * // su smin par byas pa'i sems can ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known to be limitless because the realm of sentient beings is limitless.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be immeasurable because the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be inconceivable because the realm of sentient beings is inconceivable.

original: skyes nas kyang gang gi phyir byang chub kyi don du yongs su smin par byed pa 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang gang gi phyir byang chub kyi don du yongs su smin par byed pa 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known to be incomparable because the realm of sentient beings is incomparable.🔽The perfection of wisdom should be known to be limitless because the realm of sentient beings is limitless.

analyzed: de mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o // ji ltar zhe na /

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad ces bya gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad ces bya gsungs te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known to be incomparable because the realm of sentient beings is incomparable.🔽The perfection

original: gang su dag der skyes pa'i sems can de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams thob ba dag go //
analyzed: gang su dag der skyes pa'i sems can de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams thob ba dag go //
translated: Those sentient beings who are born there have attained the bodhisattva stages.

original: de thams cad ni sems can gyi khams te sems can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de thams cad ni sems can gyi khams te sems can gyi tshogs so //
translated: All of them are the realm of sentient beings, the collection of sentient beings.

original: de'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag ni mu med pas so //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag ni mu med pas so //
translated: Because their collections of merit and wisdom are limitless.

original: sa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as limitless because the earth element is limitless.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom should be known as limitless because the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are limitless.

original: de bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten ni sa gzhi lag mthil ltar mnyam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten ni sa gzhi lag mthil ltar mnyam pa /
translated: Similarly, the world of the environment is level like the palm of the hand,

original: khang bzangs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa yo byad dang gnas thams cad kyang rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba'i rang bzhin 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du ma dag tu yang 'od zer chen po rab tu 'phro bar byed la /
analyzed: khang bzangs dang / skyed mos tshal dang / dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa yo byad dang gnas thams cad kyang rin po che sna bdun mchog tu 'bar ba'i rang bzhin 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du ma dag tu yang 'od zer chen po rab tu 'phro bar byed la /
translated: The houses, gardens, wish fulfilling trees, and so on, all the articles and places, are by nature the seven precious substances blazing with light, and they emit great rays of light into other world systems.

original: steng gi nam mkha' la yang rjes su mthun par snang ba yin no //🔽sems can yang khams drug pa ste /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la yang rjes su mthun par snang ba yin no // sems can yang khams drug pa ste /
translated: And in the sky above, they appear in a corresponding way.🔽Sentient beings also have six elements.

original: dge slong dag skyes bu 'di dag ni khams drug pa can no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: dge slong dag skyes bu 'di dag ni khams drug pa can no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Bhikṣus, these beings have six elements, as stated in the scriptures.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi lus kyang gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor sa gzhi dang / rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog dang / dbyibs dang de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa yang lta thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te gang dag gi longs spyod gcig tu bzang ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi lus kyang gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor sa gzhi dang / rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog dang / dbyibs dang de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi longs spyod dang / kun spyod pa yang lta thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te gang dag gi longs spyod gcig tu bzang ba dang /
translated: Therefore, their bodies are also majestic, their halos of light are equal to the earth, their colors and shapes are in harmony with the earth, and the enjoyments and conduct of the sentient beings who live there are superior to all others.

original: gcig tu bde ba dang / gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gcig tu dbang bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu bde ba dang / gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gcig tu dbang bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Their enjoyments are exclusively good, exclusively blissful, exclusively irreproachable, and exclusively sovereign.

original: 'di lta bu'i khams drug yongs su dag pa mu med pa ni mtshams chad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mngon par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i khams drug yongs su dag pa mu med pa ni mtshams chad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mngon par spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Such a pure realm of six elements is boundless, because it is uninterrupted and because it is not abandoned.

original: de bas na @207b de mu med pas de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na @207b de mu med pas de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is boundless, it is the cause of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One should be known in the perfection of wisdom.

original: der skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par song nas /
analyzed: der skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par song nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas born there go to infinite world systems

original: de na gnas pa'i sems can gyi mi dge ba bsags pa dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba bsags pa yang rab tu shes te /🔽de dag tshad med pas de dag yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab kyang tshad med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di nyid dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad
analyzed: de na gnas pa'i sems can gyi mi dge ba bsags pa dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba bsags pa yang rab tu shes te / de dag tshad med pas de dag yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes rab kyang tshad med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di nyid dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad
translated: and know the nonvirtue accumulated by sentient beings living there and the virtue accumulated as its antidote.🔽Since those are immeasurable, one should understand that the wisdom that comprehends them is also immeasurable.

original: med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the line “One should understand that the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because the accumulation of virtue and nonvirtue is immeasurable.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa'i phyir chos ston par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa'i phyir chos ston par byed de /
translated: Those bodhisattvas teach the Dharma for the sake of all virtuous qualities.

original: de ni chos thams cad bsags pa ste /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad bsags pa ste /
translated: That is the accumulation of all phenomena.

original: de tshad med pas de dag 'jog par byed pa'i shes rab de dag kyang tshad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de tshad med pas de dag 'jog par byed pa'i shes rab de dag kyang tshad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Since that is immeasurable, one should understand that the wisdom that comprehends them is also immeasurable.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad bsags pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom, which should be understood as the immeasurability of the accumulation of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin mu med pa thob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin mu med pa thob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
translated: The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom should be understood as the immeasurability of the attainment of the boundless samadhis of all dharmas.

original: chos ni gzungs rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni gzungs rnams so //
translated: Here, dharani means the dharanis.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems gnas pa'o //
translated: Samadhi means the stability of mind.

original: chos dang ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos dang ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Dharani and samadhi are the dharani samadhi.

original: de dag mu med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mu med pa'o //
translated: They are boundless.

original: de thob pa ni de rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de thob pa ni de rnyed pa'o //
translated: Attaining them is acquiring them.

original: gang de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thob bas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thob bas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Blessed One's statement that the perfection of wisdom should be understood as boundless due to the bodhisattvas' attainment has this meaning.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as limitless because all the qualities of a Buddha are limitless.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Here, a Buddha is the enjoyment body.

original: de'i chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
analyzed: de'i chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de /
translated: All its qualities are all the qualities of a Buddha,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
translated: the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor characteristics.

original: de dag mu med pa ni yongs su bcad du med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mu med pa ni yongs su bcad du med pa'o //
translated: They are limitless, that is, they cannot be enumerated.

original: gang gis yongs su bcad du med ce na mnyam pa ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa @208a * //
analyzed: gang gis yongs su bcad du med ce na mnyam pa ste / de bzhin gshegs pa @208a * //
translated: By whom can they not be enumerated? By one who is equal,

original: las gzhan pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gzhan pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no one like a Tathāgata.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu nyid kyang mu med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu nyid kyang mu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom should be known as limitless, just like the Blessed One.

original: gang gis de dag gi rgyu thams cad yang dag par shes pa dang / yang dag par grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de dag gi rgyu thams cad yang dag par shes pa dang / yang dag par grub pa'o //
translated: It is the correct knowledge and the correct accomplishment of all the causes of those .

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise declares:🔽This body of thirty-two marks

original: mtshan ni sum cu tsa gnyis dang // dpe byad brgyad cu'i bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: mtshan ni sum cu tsa gnyis dang // dpe byad brgyad cu'i bdag nyid 'di //
translated: and eighty minor characteristics🔽is the Buddha's beatific body,

original: theg chen nye bar longs spyod phyir //🔽thub pa'i longs spyod rdzogs skur bzhed //
analyzed: theg chen nye bar longs spyod phyir // thub pa'i longs spyod rdzogs skur bzhed //
translated: because it enjoys the Great Vehicle.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The words

original: theg chen nye bar longs spyod phyir //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni //
analyzed: theg chen nye bar longs spyod phyir // zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni //
translated: because it enjoys the Great Vehicle

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gsungs so//
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gsungs so//
translated: indicate the beatific body.

original: de la dang po'i lnga ni dbang po'i rdo rje'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la dang po'i lnga ni dbang po'i rdo rje'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Of these, the first five are the characteristics of the vajra-like sense organs.

original: phyag zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang rus sbal zhabs //
analyzed: phyag zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang rus sbal zhabs //
translated: He has the marks of wheels on his hands and feet, and tortoise feet.

original: phyag dang zhabs sor dra bas 'brel ba dang // phyag ni zhabs bcas 'jam zhing gzhon sha can //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs sor dra bas 'brel ba dang // phyag ni zhabs bcas 'jam zhing gzhon sha can //
translated: His fingers and toes are connected by webs, and his hands and feet are soft and youthful.

original: 'di yi sku ni bdun dag mtho ba dang // sor mo ring dang rting yangs sku che drang //
analyzed: 'di yi sku ni bdun dag mtho ba dang // sor mo ring dang rting yangs sku che drang //
translated: His body has seven convex surfaces, long fingers, broad heels, and a large body.

original: zhabs long mi mngon spu ni gyen du phyogs //
analyzed: zhabs long mi mngon spu ni gyen du phyogs //
translated: His ankles do not protrude, and his body hair points upward.

original: byin pa ae na ya'i 'dra phyag ring mdzes //
analyzed: byin pa ae na ya'i 'dra phyag ring mdzes //
translated: His calves are like those of the Ena deer, and his arms are long and beautiful.

original: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa'i mchog //
analyzed: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa'i mchog //
translated: The supreme one has the genitals concealed in a sheath.🔽The skin is golden colored, the skin is smooth,🔽The body hair is well-placed, growing singly,

original: pags pa gser mdog pags pa srab pa dang // spu ni re re nas g-yas legs 'khrungs dang // zhal mdzod spus brgyan ro stod seng ge'i 'dra //
analyzed: pags pa gser mdog pags pa srab pa dang // spu ni re re nas g-yas legs 'khrungs dang // zhal mdzod spus brgyan ro stod seng ge'i 'dra //
translated: The chest is adorned with a śrīvatsa, and the torso is like a lion’s.

original: 'di yi dpung ba'i mgo zlum thal gong rgyas //
analyzed: 'di yi dpung ba'i mgo zlum thal gong rgyas //
translated: The shoulders are rounded, and the upper arms are full.

original: 'di la ro mi zhim pa ro mchog snang //
analyzed: 'di la ro mi zhim pa ro mchog snang //
translated: For him, unpleasant tastes appear as the best of tastes.

original: sku ni nya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab //
analyzed: sku ni nya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab //
translated: The body is well-proportioned like a nyagrodha tree.

original: gtsug tor yar 'phags ljags ring mdzes pa dang // tshangs dbyangs 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra dang tshems //
analyzed: gtsug tor yar 'phags ljags ring mdzes pa dang // tshangs dbyangs 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra dang tshems //
translated: The uṣṇīṣa is prominent, the tongue is long and beautiful,🔽The voice is like Brahmā’s, the cheeks are like a lion’s, and the jaw is full.🔽The teeth are very white, equal, and fine,🔽And there are exactly forty of them.

original: shin tu dkar dang tshad mnyam thags bzangs dang // grangs ni bzhi bcu tham par tshang ba dang // spyan ni mthon mthing spyan rdzi ba mchog gi //
analyzed: shin tu dkar dang tshad mnyam thags bzangs dang // grangs ni bzhi bcu tham par tshang ba dang // spyan ni mthon mthing spyan rdzi ba mchog gi //
translated: The eyes are deep blue, and the eyelashes are like a magnificent bull’s.

original: 'dra ba 'di dag sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan //
analyzed: 'dra ba 'di dag sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan //
translated: These are the thirty-two marks.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: zhabs ni rkang pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs ni rkang pa'o //
translated: “Feet” means feet.

original: 'di la 'khor los mtshan pa'i phyag dang / zhabs yo pas na phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan no //
analyzed: 'di la 'khor los mtshan pa'i phyag dang / zhabs yo pas na phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan no //
translated: The hands and feet are marked with wheels, because they are marked with wheels.

original: 'di zhabs ru sbal ltar shin tu gnas pa yod pa'i phyir rus sbal zhabs so //
analyzed: 'di zhabs ru sbal ltar shin tu gnas pa yod pa'i phyir rus sbal zhabs so //
translated: The feet are like tortoises, because they are like the soles of tortoise feet.

original: de dag ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //🔽'di la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel ba yod pas na /
analyzed: de dag ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o // 'di la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel ba yod pas na /
translated: These are the characteristics of the bodhisattva's body.🔽The fingers and toes are joined by webs,

original: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bas 'brel ba'o //
translated: because the fingers and toes are joined by webs.

original: @208b phyag ni zhabs bcas 'jam zhing gzhon sha can //
analyzed: @208b phyag ni zhabs bcas 'jam zhing gzhon sha can //
translated: The hands and feet are soft and youthful.

original: 'di zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the third characteristic.

original: 'de yi sku ni bdun dag mtho ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa'i gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'de yi sku ni bdun dag mtho ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa'i gsum pa'o //
translated: The body is well-proportioned like a banyan tree.

original: sku ni rten no //
analyzed: sku ni rten no //
translated: The body is the basis.🔽The body is well-proportioned like a banyan tree, because it is well-proportioned like a banyan tree.🔽The body has seven prominent parts.🔽This is the fourth characteristic.

original: bdun mtho bas mtshon pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdun mtho bas mtshon pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body has seven prominent parts.

original: 'di dag gis ni mtshan lnga bstan te phyag dang zhabs 'khor los mtshan pa dang zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni mtshan lnga bstan te phyag dang zhabs 'khor los mtshan pa dang zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / bdun mtho ba'o //
translated: These are the five marks: hands and feet with webs, long fingers and toes, high-set heels, body hair that springs upward, and seven convex surfaces.

original: sku gtsang ba nyid dang / sku 'jam pa nyid dang / sku rnam par dag pa nyid dang / tshan rdzogs pa nyid dang / sku kho lag yangs shing mdzes pa nyid do //
analyzed: sku gtsang ba nyid dang / sku 'jam pa nyid dang / sku rnam par dag pa nyid dang / tshan rdzogs pa nyid dang / sku kho lag yangs shing mdzes pa nyid do //
translated: His gait is even, his eyes are pure, his skin is very delicate, his body is not stooped, full, and very firm.

original: gom snyoms spyan ni dag pa dang // shin tu gzhon mdog can nyid dang // sku zhum med de rgyas pa dang // shin tu grims pa'i sku nyid dang // zhes bya ba 'di ni drug ste /🔽gom pa snyoms pa nyid dang / spyan rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sku gzhon sha can nyid dang / sku zhum pa med pa nyid dang / sku rgyas pa nyid dang / sku shin tu grims pa nyid do //
analyzed: gom snyoms spyan ni dag pa dang // shin tu gzhon mdog can nyid dang // sku zhum med de rgyas pa dang // shin tu grims pa'i sku nyid dang // zhes bya ba 'di ni drug ste / gom pa snyoms pa nyid dang / spyan rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sku gzhon sha can nyid dang / sku zhum pa med pa nyid dang / sku rgyas pa nyid dang / sku shin tu grims pa nyid do //
translated: These are the six:🔽even gait, pure eyes, delicate skin, an erect body, a full body, and a very firm body.

original: yan lag shin tu rnam 'byes dang // gzigs pa rab rib dag pa dang // dku zlum skabs phyin ma rnyongs dang // phyang nge ba dang lte ba ni //
analyzed: yan lag shin tu rnam 'byes dang // gzigs pa rab rib dag pa dang // dku zlum skabs phyin ma rnyongs dang // phyang nge ba dang lte ba ni //
translated: His limbs are well rounded, his eyes are clear and unclouded, his belly is round, full, and without flaws, and his navel is deep.

original: zab dang g-yas phyogs 'khyil ba dang / kun nas blta na sdug pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni dgu ste /
analyzed: zab dang g-yas phyogs 'khyil ba dang / kun nas blta na sdug pa dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni dgu ste /
translated: The first half of the next verse shows the other nine:

original: yan lag dang nying lag rnam par shin tu 'byes pa nyid dang / gzigs pa rab rib med cing dag pa nyid dang / dku zlum pa nyid dang / dku skabs phyin pa nyid dang / dku @210b ma rnyongs pa nyid dang / phyal phyang nge ba nyid dang /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rnam par shin tu 'byes pa nyid dang / gzigs pa rab rib med cing dag pa nyid dang / dku zlum pa nyid dang / dku skabs phyin pa nyid dang / dku @210b ma rnyongs pa nyid dang / phyal phyang nge ba nyid dang /
translated: His limbs and digits are well rounded, his eyes are clear and bright, his belly is rounded, his belly is even, his belly is not protruding, his belly is not sagging,

original: lte ba zab pa nyid dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa nyid dang / kun nas mdzes pa nyid do //
analyzed: lte ba zab pa nyid dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil pa nyid dang / kun nas mdzes pa nyid do //
translated: his navel is deep, his navel is coiled to the right, and he is altogether pleasing to behold.

original: kun spyod gtsang dang sku la ni //
analyzed: kun spyod gtsang dang sku la ni //
translated: His conduct is pure, his body🔽is without moles or blemishes, his hands are soft like cotton, his hand lines are lustrous, deep, and long,

original: sme ba gnag bag med pa dang // phyag ni shing bal ltar 'jam dang // phyag ris mdangs yod zab ring dang // zhal ni ha cang mi ring dang // zhal gzugs gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sme ba gnag bag med pa dang // phyag ni shing bal ltar 'jam dang // phyag ris mdangs yod zab ring dang // zhal ni ha cang mi ring dang // zhal gzugs gzugs brnyan 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: his face is not too long, his face is like a mirror,🔽and his voice is like an echo.

original: zhal 'di la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhal 'di la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That face on which the reflection of form appears is so called because of that.

original: zhal ni zhal gdong ste /
analyzed: zhal ni zhal gdong ste /
translated: Face means face.

original: zhal gdong la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhal gdong la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'o //
translated: The reflection of form appears on the face.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis pa 'dis ni brgyad de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis pa 'dis ni brgyad de /
translated: The first half of the third verse shows eight marks:🔽the tongue is supple, slender, and red, and the voice is like thunder,

original: kun du spyod pa gtsang ba nyad dang / sku la sme ba gnag bag med pa nyid dang / phyag shing bal ltar 'jam pa nyid dang / phyag gi ser mo mdangs yod pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo zab pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba nyid dang /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gtsang ba nyad dang / sku la sme ba gnag bag med pa nyid dang / phyag shing bal ltar 'jam pa nyid dang / phyag gi ser mo mdangs yod pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo zab pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba nyid dang /
translated: the face is like the full moon, and the eyes are like the petals of a blue lotus.🔽The second half of the verse shows two marks:

original: zhal gdong la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhal gdong la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba nyid do //
translated: the eyelashes are like a bull's, and the face has the reflection of form.🔽The supple tongue, slender, red, and with the voice of thunder,

original: ljags mnyen pa dang srab pa dang / dmar dang 'brug gi sgra nyid dang // gsung mnyen 'jam dang mche ba zlum //
analyzed: ljags mnyen pa dang srab pa dang / dmar dang 'brug gi sgra nyid dang // gsung mnyen 'jam dang mche ba zlum //
translated: the gentle speech, rounded teeth,

original: rno dang dkar dang mnyam pa dang // byin gyis phra dang shangs mtho dang // mchog tu dag pa dag dang ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rno dang dkar dang mnyam pa dang // byin gyis phra dang shangs mtho dang // mchog tu dag pa dag dang ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: well-rounded, with a high nose, and most pure,

original: mchog ni dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “supreme” means “excellent.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: By these one and a half verses, there are twelve:

original: ljags mnyel pa nyid dang / ljags srab pa nyid dang / ljags dmar ba nyid dang / glang po'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa nyid dang / gsung snyan cing mnyen la 'jam pa nyid dang / mche ba zlum pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ljags mnyel pa nyid dang / ljags srab pa nyid dang / ljags dmar ba nyid dang / glang po'i nga ro dang / 'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa nyid dang / gsung snyan cing mnyen la 'jam pa nyid dang / mche ba zlum pa nyid dang /
translated: a long tongue, a slender tongue, a red tongue, an elephant’s voice, a voice like thunder, a melodious, gentle, and soft voice, round canine teeth,

original: mche ba rno ba nyid dang / mche ba dkar ba nyid dang / mche ba mnyam pa nyid dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / shangs mtho ba nyid dang / shangs gtsang ba nyid do //🔽spyan yangs pa dang rdzi ma stug //
analyzed: mche ba rno ba nyid dang / mche ba dkar ba nyid dang / mche ba mnyam pa nyid dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / shangs mtho ba nyid dang / shangs gtsang ba nyid do //🔽spyan yangs pa dang rdzi ma stug //
translated: sharp canine teeth, white canine teeth, even canine teeth, well-rounded canine teeth, and a high nose.🔽1.2.2.3. “wide eyes, thick eyelashes,

original: padma'i 'dab ma 'dra ba dang / smin tshugs ring dang 'jam pa dang // snum dang spu ni mnyam pa dang // phyag ring rgyas dang snyan mnyam dang // nyams pa rnam par spangs pa dang / 'phral ba @211a * //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma 'dra ba dang / smin tshugs ring dang 'jam pa dang // snum dang spu ni mnyam pa dang // phyag ring rgyas dang snyan mnyam dang // nyams pa rnam par spangs pa dang / 'phral ba @211a * //
translated: His eyelashes are like those of a magnificent heifer, His eyebrows are long, smooth, and glossy, His body hair is even, His arms are long and muscular, His ears are even, He is free from defects, His forehead is🔽wide,🔽

original: legs par 'byes pa dang // dbyes che ba dang dbu rgyas dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis po 'dis ni bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: legs par 'byes pa dang // dbyes che ba dang dbu rgyas dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis po 'dis ni bcu gsum mo //
translated: The two verses beginning with “lotus-petal-like hands” describe thirteen marks:

original: spyan yangs pa nyid dang / rdzi ma stug pa nyid dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma lta bu nyid dang / smin tshugs ring ba nyid dang / smin ma snum pa nyid dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing rgyas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: spyan yangs pa nyid dang / rdzi ma stug pa nyid dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma lta bu nyid dang / smin tshugs ring ba nyid dang / smin ma snum pa nyid dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing rgyas pa nyid dang /
translated: lotus-petal-like hands, long eyelashes, eyes like lotus petals, with black and white parts distinct, long eyebrows, glossy eyebrows, symmetrical eyebrows, long arms,

original: snyan mnyam pa nyid dang / 'phral ba legs par 'byes pa nyid dang / 'phral ba dbyes che ba nyid dang / dbu shin tu rgyas pa nyid dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag dang // stug 'jam ma 'dzings ngo bo dang // dbu skra mi gshor nyid dang ni //
analyzed: snyan mnyam pa nyid dang / 'phral ba legs par 'byes pa nyid dang / 'phral ba dbyes che ba nyid dang / dbu shin tu rgyas pa nyid dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag dang // stug 'jam ma 'dzings ngo bo dang // dbu skra mi gshor nyid dang ni //
translated: thick, soft, uncurled,🔽the hair of the head is not disheveled,🔽the hair of the head is attractive to men,

original: dbu skra skyes bu yid 'phrog dang // dpal gyi be'u dang bkri shis ni //
analyzed: dbu skra skyes bu yid 'phrog dang // dpal gyi be'u dang bkri shis ni //
translated: the swastika and auspiciousness

original: g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa ste //
translated: are adorned with the curl between the eyebrows.

original: sangs rgyas dpe byad bzang por bzhed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpe byad bzang por bzhed //
translated: These are asserted as the Buddha’s excellent signs.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni bdun te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed dang gnyis po 'dis ni bdun te /
translated: These two and a half verses are the seven.

original: dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa nyid dang / dbu skra stug pa nyid dang / dbu skra 'jam pa nyid dang / dbu skra ma 'dzings pa nyid dang / dbu skra mi gshor ba nyid dang / dbu skra dri zhim pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa nyid dang / dbu skra stug pa nyid dang / dbu skra 'jam pa nyid dang / dbu skra ma 'dzings pa nyid dang / dbu skra mi gshor ba nyid dang / dbu skra dri zhim pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pas brgyan pa nyid do //
translated: His hair is as black as a bee, his hair is thick, his hair is soft, his hair is not frizzy, his hair does not stand on end, his hair has a pleasant odor, and the palms and soles of his hands and feet are marked with auspicious and swastika designs.

original: thams cad gcig tu byas pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu byas pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'o //
translated: All of these together are the eighty minor marks of the Buddhas.

original: 'di ni long spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni long spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: This is the enjoyment body.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /🔽gang gi srid pa mi srid par //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las / gang gi srid pa mi srid par //
translated: With regard to the emanation body, the treatise declares:🔽The body that acts equally

original: 'gro la phan pa sna tshogs dag //🔽mnyam pa mdzad pa'i sku de ni //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa sna tshogs dag // mnyam pa mdzad pa'i sku de ni //
translated: To benefit beings in all ways🔽Without the possibility of nonexistence

original: thub pa'i sprul sku rgyun mi 'chad //🔽de bzhin de las 'khor ba'i bar //
analyzed: thub pa'i sprul sku rgyun mi 'chad // de bzhin de las 'khor ba'i bar //
translated: Is the Sage’s uninterrupted emanation body.🔽And:🔽Likewise, it is accepted that

original: rgyun mi 'chad bar bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad bar bzhed pa yin //
translated: The emanation body continues until the end of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The treatise declares:

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:🔽“One should understand the infinity of the perfection of wisdom by means of the infinity of all things.”

original: chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji srid sa la spyod pa dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i 'gro ba dang / gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji srid sa la spyod pa dang / bar snang la spyod pa'i 'gro ba dang / gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus dang /
translated: The bodies of all beings who live on the earth, in the sky, and in the heavens, and the bodies of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, are all things.

original: rag gi bsdus pa ni chos te /
analyzed: rag gi bsdus pa ni chos te /
translated: The bodies of all beings are included in the aggregates.

original: sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams @211b mtha' yas pa dag tu sprul pa de dag ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams @211b mtha' yas pa dag tu sprul pa de dag ni chos thams cad de /
translated: In order to convert beings,🔽the Lord manifests emanations in infinite world systems.

original: de dag mu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those emanations are all things, and one should understand that they are infinite.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gang gi sprul pa de dag go //🔽stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi sprul pa de dag go // stong pa nyid mu med pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the emanations.🔽“One should understand the infinity of the perfection of wisdom by means of the infinity of emptiness.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar sprul pa'i sku de dag mu med pa de bzhin du de dag gi stong pa nyid kyang mu med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar sprul pa'i sku de dag mu med pa de bzhin du de dag gi stong pa nyid kyang mu med do //
translated: Just as those emanation bodies are infinite, so also is their emptiness.

original: gang gis stong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis stong zhe na /
translated: By what is it empty?

original: sems dang sems las byung nga la rag las pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung nga la rag las pa ste /
translated: It is empty by the mind and mental factors, which are dependent on others.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no //🔽de'i phyir de yang mu med pas mu med pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no // de'i phyir de yang mu med pas mu med pa ste /
translated: It is like the illusory man.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also infinite because of the infinity of the mind and mental factors, as before.

original: ji ltar yang de dag lus dang ngag gi sprul pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ci'i phyir mi sprul zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de dag lus dang ngag gi sprul pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ci'i phyir mi sprul zhe na /
translated: Why do the mind and mental factors not emanate in the same way that bodies and speech are emanated?

original: de la nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa'i sems can mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa ni /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / sngon med pa'i sems can mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa ni /
translated: Because there is no cause for appropriating them, and because sentient beings who did not exist previously would not arise.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba la yang 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba la yang 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not accepted that the emanations of the Buddhas are mind and mental factors?

original: sku gsung thugs kyi sprul pa ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi sprul pa ni //
translated: The emanations of body, speech, and mind

original: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can yin //
translated: are the activity of the method of application.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: This is stated in the verse.

original: 'on kyang nye bar len pa yod na yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar len pa yod na yod par 'gyur te /
translated: However, if there is appropriation, they exist.

original: lhas byin gyis brlabs nas rmi lam du bstan pa lta bu 'am /
analyzed: lhas byin gyis brlabs nas rmi lam du bstan pa lta bu 'am /
translated: For example, it is like the dream that was taught by the blessing of Devadatta.

original: tshig las tshig gi don go ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig las tshig gi don go ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like understanding the meaning of a word from another word.

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba mu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because mind and mental factors are limitless,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it should be understood that the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa dag tu sems can gyi khams mu med pa'i spyod pa mu med pa la rnam par gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa dag tu sems can gyi khams mu med pa'i spyod pa mu med pa la rnam par gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen the limitless conduct of the limitless realm of sentient beings in the various world systems,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa yin te /
translated: the Blessed One teaches the Dharma through various emanations.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi spyod pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, because the conduct of mind is limitless, it should be understood that the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: sems can de dag gis kyang ji ltar bstan pa'i chos la dmigs nas gnyen po'i dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can de dag gis kyang ji ltar bstan pa'i chos la dmigs nas gnyen po'i dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: And those sentient beings, having focused on the Dharma as taught, will give rise to the virtuous qualities that are the antidotes.

original: des kyang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des kyang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: And by that, they will abandon the non-virtuous qualities that are their counteragents.

original: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos gzhal du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because wholesome and unwholesome dharmas are immeasurable,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhal du med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhal du med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be known as immeasurable.

original: ji ste gang @212a * //
analyzed: ji ste gang @212a * //
translated: If it is asked, “What is the difference between the emanation body and the enjoyment body?”

original: sprul pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yin /
analyzed: sprul pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yin /
translated: The emanation body is the body of the Bhagavān that is like an emanation.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it because the Bhagavān emanates?”

original: de ltar na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa yang sgyu ma mkhan gyi lus su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa yang sgyu ma mkhan gyi lus su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, the elephants and so on emanated by a magician would also be the body of the magician.

original: rang gi skur byin gyis brlabs pa der sprul pa'i phyir nyid kyi sku bzhin du gshegs pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / bya ba la sogs pa mdzad pa de yang de'i sku yin no //
analyzed: rang gi skur byin gyis brlabs pa der sprul pa'i phyir nyid kyi sku bzhin du gshegs pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / bya ba la sogs pa mdzad pa de yang de'i sku yin no //
translated: Because it is emanated into the body that is blessed as one’s own body, the going, the practice of austerities, the deeds, and so on are also that body.

original: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i sku bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i sku bstan te /
translated: Here, this is the teaching of the emanation body of the Bhagavān.

original: de dag ni sku gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag ni sku gsum mo //
translated: Those are the three bodies.

original: da ni mdzad pa mdor bsdus nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mdzad pa mdor bsdus nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the deeds will be explained in brief.

original: de yang seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he roars the lion's roar,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: he is to be known as the perfection of wisdom.

original: ri dags rnams kyi mchog ni seng ge'o //
analyzed: ri dags rnams kyi mchog ni seng ge'o //
translated: The lion is the king of beasts.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa ni skyes bu seng ge zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa ni skyes bu seng ge zhes brjod do //
translated: Because he is similar to him, the holy man is called the lion of men.

original: 'di ni khyad par du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par du gyur pa ste /
translated: This is his special quality.

original: lha dang mi rnams la sogs pa skyes bu thams cad kyi dam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams la sogs pa skyes bu thams cad kyi dam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata is the best of all holy men, gods, men, etc.

original: de la seng ge zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la seng ge zhes brjod do //
translated: He is called the lion.

original: de'i chos ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan pha rol rgol ba'i ri dags thams cad 'jigs par mdzad pas seng ge'i sgra zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i chos ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan pha rol rgol ba'i ri dags thams cad 'jigs par mdzad pas seng ge'i sgra zhes brjod do //
translated: His Dharma is called the lion's roar because it fulfills all wishes and terrifies all the beasts of opponents.

original: seng ge'i rgyal mtshan bzhin no //
analyzed: seng ge'i rgyal mtshan bzhin no //
translated: It is like the lion's banner.

original: de sgrog pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrog pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: Its roar is its teaching.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: Its reality is just that.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab ni /
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the Lord

original: bgrod par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand that the perfection of wisdom that is the object of the path is the perfection of the other perfections.

original: de yang seng ge'i sgra ste /
analyzed: de yang seng ge'i sgra ste /
translated: This is the lion's roar.

original: mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ston pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ston pa ste /
translated: It teaches twenty seven deeds.

original: de ni rgyas par yum chen mo dag las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyas par yum chen mo dag las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the great mother sutras.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In this regard, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:🔽The pacification of the actions of migrating

original: 'gro rnams zhi ba'i las dang ni //
analyzed: 'gro rnams zhi ba'i las dang ni //
translated: beings,

original: bsdu rnams bzhi la dgod pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs bcas pa yi //
analyzed: bsdu rnams bzhi la dgod pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs bcas pa yi //
translated: the establishment of the four means of gathering,

original: rnam par byang ba rtogs pa dang // sems can rnams don ji bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rtogs pa dang // sems can rnams don ji bzhin gyi //
translated: the realization of complete purification🔽from affliction,🔽the meaning of the reality of sentient beings,

original: don dang pha rol phyin drug dang // sangs rgyas lam dang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: don dang pha rol phyin drug dang // sangs rgyas lam dang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: the six perfections, the path of buddhahood,🔽the two kinds of emptiness by nature,🔽the inexhaustible, the signless, the objectless,🔽the full maturation of embodied beings,

original: stong pa nyid gnyis mi zad dang // brda dang dmigs pa med pa dang // lus can rnams ni yongs @212b smin dang // byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ni //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gnyis mi zad dang // brda dang dmigs pa med pa dang // lus can rnams ni yongs @212b smin dang // byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ni //
translated: the bodhisattva path,

original: mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa dang // byang chub thob dang sangs rgyas zhing //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa dang // byang chub thob dang sangs rgyas zhing //
translated: To avert attachment, to attain enlightenment, to attain a buddhafield,🔽To be pure, to be certain, to benefit sentient beings immeasurably,

original: rnam par dag dang nges pa dang // sems can don ni tshad med dang // sangs rgyas rten sogs yon tan dang // byang chub yan lag las rnams ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag dang nges pa dang // sems can don ni tshad med dang // sangs rgyas rten sogs yon tan dang // byang chub yan lag las rnams ni //
translated: To have the qualities of being a buddha’s support and so forth, to have the factors of enlightenment,🔽To have activities that are not wasted, to see the truth, to abandon error,

original: chud mi za dang bden mthong dang // phyin ci log ni spang pa dang // de gzhi med pa'i tshul dang ni //
analyzed: chud mi za dang bden mthong dang // phyin ci log ni spang pa dang // de gzhi med pa'i tshul dang ni //
translated: To have the mode of being without a basis,

original: rnam par byang dang tshogs dang ni //🔽'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
analyzed: rnam par byang dang tshogs dang ni // 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
translated: To have complete purification, to have the accumulations,🔽To have no knowledge of the difference between the conditioned and the unconditioned,

original: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // mya ngan 'das la dgod pa ste //🔽chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
analyzed: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // mya ngan 'das la dgod pa ste // chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
translated: And to establish beings in nirvana—🔽These are asserted to be the twenty-seven

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du bzhed //
translated: Aspects of the activity of the dharmakāya.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku gang gis dmyal ba rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me zhi bar 'gyur ba 'di ltar chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du dud 'gro dag la yang rang gi khrag la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i sku gang gis dmyal ba rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me zhi bar 'gyur ba 'di ltar chos ston pa dang / de bzhin du dud 'gro dag la yang rang gi khrag la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang /
translated: And likewise, for the animals, he gives his own blood and so forth,

original: de bzhin du yi dags rnams la yang bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa byin nas chos bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi dags rnams la yang bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa byin nas chos bstan te /
translated: and likewise, for the hungry ghosts, he gives food, drink, and so forth, and teaches the Dharma.

original: sems dad par 'dzin pa dang / mngon par dad pa des rang gi 'gro ba las shi 'phos te /
analyzed: sems dad par 'dzin pa dang / mngon par dad pa des rang gi 'gro ba las shi 'phos te /
translated: By that faith and clear faith in mind, they die and transmigrate from their own migrations,

original: lha dang mi rnams su skye bar mdzad de /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams su skye bar mdzad de /
translated: and are born as gods and humans.

original: lha rnams la yang theg pa dman pa la mos shing dang bar 'gyur ba'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: lha rnams la yang theg pa dman pa la mos shing dang bar 'gyur ba'i chos bstan te /
translated: And for the gods, he teaches the Dharma that is devoted to the lower vehicle,

original: mi rnams su skye bar byas nas nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi bar la gnas par byed pa 'di ni 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i phrin las so //
analyzed: mi rnams su skye bar byas nas nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi bar la gnas par byed pa 'di ni 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i phrin las so //
translated: and having caused them to be born as humans, he causes them to abide in the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas. This is the pacifying activity for migrating beings.

original: yang gang dag mi rnams kyi phyi nang gi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa la slob par byed pa 'di ni bsdu pa'i dngos po la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: yang gang dag mi rnams kyi phyi nang gi zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa la slob par byed pa 'di ni bsdu pa'i dngos po la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Moreover, the activity of establishing in the means of gathering is that by which one teaches others the giving of material things, both mundane and supramundane, to people, both internal and external, the giving of Dharma, agreeable speech, beneficial conduct, and sameness of purpose.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Affliction is the obscuration of afflictions and the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de gnyis nub pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nub pa ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: The disappearance of those two is purification.

original: de yang gang zag dang / chos la bdag med par shes pa'i phyir 'di ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: de yang gang zag dang / chos la bdag med par shes pa'i phyir 'di ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: Moreover, it is conventional because of the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: don dam par chos kyi dbyings las gzhan med de /🔽'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba shes pa la @213a * //
analyzed: don dam par chos kyi dbyings las gzhan med de / 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba shes pa la @213a * //
translated: Ultimately, there is nothing other than the realm of the Dharma.

original: dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in the knowledge of affliction and purification.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis bza' ba dang / bca' ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyis 'jig rten dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis bza' ba dang / bca' ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyis 'jig rten dga' bar byed de /
translated: Just as a magician delights the world with various things such as food and drink,

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi dngos po 'di thams cad med par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi dngos po 'di thams cad med par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and yet it is not that he knows all these worldly things to be nonexistent.

original: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs par cung zad kyang mthong ba med de /
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs par cung zad kyang mthong ba med de /
translated: And one who practices the perfection of wisdom does not see the slightest thing apart from the dharma-element.

original: sems can yang ma yin /
analyzed: sems can yang ma yin /
translated: There are no sentient beings,

original: sems can du btags pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du btags pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and there is no designation of sentient beings.

original: chos rnams kyang bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyang bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the dharmas are selfless.

original: 'di ni sems can rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing sentient beings in their own welfare.

original: de bdag nyid kyang sbyin par byed /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang sbyin par byed /
translated: He gives himself,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed /
translated: he connects others to giving,

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa rjod par byed /
translated: and he praises giving.

original: gang gzhan dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing mthun par byed do //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing mthun par byed do //
translated: He praises those others who are practicing generosity and he rejoices in it.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims srung bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, he should say, “I myself will practice morality,” and so on.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the evolutionary action of establishing in the six perfections.

original: bdag nyid kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas 'jug par byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas 'jug par byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyang bslab pa'i gzhi lnga nas /
translated: He himself practices the ten virtues and he encourages others to take them up.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te /
translated: He himself fulfills the five basic precepts up to the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics of a great being.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the evolutionary action of establishing in the path of the Buddhas.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la rdzogs pa'i chos ston pa na /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa la rdzogs pa'i chos ston pa na /
translated: Here, when the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma of the perfections to all beings,

original: de dag gi 'khor gsum dag pa'i 'bras bu yang rang bzhin gyis stong par ston par byed de /
analyzed: de dag gi 'khor gsum dag pa'i 'bras bu yang rang bzhin gyis stong par ston par byed de /
translated: The result of the purification of the three spheres is also taught to be empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de dag de bzhin du bsgoms pas lhag par khyad par du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin du bsgoms pas lhag par khyad par du 'gro ste /
translated: By cultivating them in that way, they become increasingly superior.

original: des na de dag stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la lan mang du sgom par byed pas /
analyzed: des na de dag stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la lan mang du sgom par byed pas /
translated: Therefore, they cultivate the nature of emptiness many times.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bar du khyad par 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi bar du khyad par 'gro bar byed de /
translated: They become increasingly superior up to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in emptiness.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi chos thams cad de /
translated: All phenomena are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa yang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa yang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not other than that.

original: chos thams cad kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Phenomena are not other than that.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid chos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid chos so //
translated: However, emptiness of intrinsic nature is a phenomenon.

original: de nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: That itself is emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: @213b 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: @213b 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in the nondual Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i chos ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i chos ni gang yang med de /
translated: The Lord: There is no dharma at all which the Tathagata has fully known.

original: gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽phung po dang khams la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / phung po dang khams la sogs pa nas /
translated: And having fully known it,🔽he has taught the dharma of the aggregates, elements, sensefields,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chos ston pa de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chos ston pa de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin te /
translated: up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: 'di ni brdar btags pa shes pas dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni brdar btags pa shes pas dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the Tathagata's skill in designation, through his knowledge of conventional truth.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bslabs pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la bslabs pa de lta na yang /
translated: If one trains in all dharmas, i.e. the perfections, etc.,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi nus la gal te yang de dag la yang spyod cing /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi nus la gal te yang de dag la yang spyod cing /
translated: but is not able to win full enlightenment, and if one also trains in them,

original: 'khor gsum gyi 'bras bu de dag la yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par nus te //
analyzed: 'khor gsum gyi 'bras bu de dag la yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par nus te //
translated: and does not review the result of the three spheres, then one is able to win full enlightenment.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa med pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa med pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the Tathagata's skill in establishing the nonapprehension of all dharmas.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: If a bodhisattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can dang sems can du brtags pa yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du brtags pa yang mi dmigs te /
translated: he does not apprehend a sentient being or a designation of a sentient being.

original: 'on kyang de kun rdzob mthong nas sems can rnams dngos por dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang de kun rdzob mthong nas sems can rnams dngos por dmigs pas /
translated: Nevertheless, seeing the conventional, he sees sentient beings as having a real basis.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa na /
translated: When they are afflicted,

original: des de dag gi de rnams spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des de dag gi de rnams spang pa'i phyir /
translated: he causes them to abandon that.

original: theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: He brings them to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s activity of establishing sentient beings in bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa re re la sogs pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa re re la sogs pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: When he practices the perfections one by one,

original: sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la slob par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la slob par byed de /
translated: he causes sentient beings to train in all virtuous qualities and in the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s activity of establishing sentient beings in the path.

original: de de ltar nye bar rtog pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar nye bar rtog pa na /
translated: When he investigates in that way,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: all phenomena are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: And he does not even settle down on emptiness.

original: de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, he should cultivate non-settling down on all dharmas,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: and he should practice generosity, etc.

original: 'khor gsum po de dag la yang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum po de dag la yang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: And he should not even settle down on those three spheres.

original: 'di ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spangs pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spangs pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is his deed of establishing in the relinquishment of all settling down.

original: lam gyis byang chub thob pa la yang ma yin /
analyzed: lam gyis byang chub thob pa la yang ma yin /
translated: It is not by the Path that he attains enlightenment,

original: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it by what is not the Path.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub nyid lam mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub nyid lam mo //
translated: Because enlightenment itself is the Path,

original: lam nyid byang @214a * //
analyzed: lam nyid byang @214a * //
translated: and the Path itself is enlightenment.

original: chub bo // gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyid sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chub bo // gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' nyid sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the Bodhisattva himself becomes the Buddha.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: When the Bodhisattva has completed all the dharmas of the Buddha,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
translated: and has entered into the diamond-like concentration,

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis /
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis /
translated: And with the wisdom that comes in a single instant,🔽

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he attains perfect awakening in a single moment of wisdom,

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: he is a Tathāgata,

original: thams cad gzigs pa dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes ston te /
translated: a knower of all, endowed with all-seeing knowledge.

original: 'di ni byang chub thob pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub thob pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is his activity of establishing them in the attainment of awakening.

original: de bdag dang gzhan dag gi tshul khrims 'chal pa la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / theg pa dman pa'i 'bras bu lnga mngon sum du byed cing reg pa dag gi skabs mi 'byed cing phung po dang /
analyzed: de bdag dang gzhan dag gi tshul khrims 'chal pa la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / theg pa dman pa'i 'bras bu lnga mngon sum du byed cing reg pa dag gi skabs mi 'byed cing phung po dang /
translated: He does not allow any opportunity for the ten unwholesome courses of action, which are included in the immorality of oneself and others, for the counteragents to the six perfections, or for the actualization and contact with the five lower-vehicle fruits.

original: khams la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi gnas ngan len bsal nas /
analyzed: khams la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi gnas ngan len bsal nas /
translated: Having eliminated the negative tendencies of the discriminations of all dharmas, whether contaminated or uncontaminated, such as the aggregates and elements,

original: rang yang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas par byed la /
analyzed: rang yang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas par byed la /
translated: He himself abides in the virtuous qualities of the perfections and so forth,

original: gzhan yang de dag la 'god par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag la 'god par byed cing /
translated: and he establishes others in them as well.

original: bdag gi dge pa'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: bdag gi dge pa'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: He makes his own roots of virtue common to all sentient beings

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par yongs su sngo bar byed cing /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par yongs su sngo bar byed cing /
translated: and dedicates them to perfect complete enlightenment, to omniscience, and to the purification of his own buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin du 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir smon lam yang mdo ji lta ba bzhin du 'debs par byed de /
translated: He makes prayers, in accordance with the sutras, for the purification of the buddhafield.

original: 'di ni sang rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni sang rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is his activity of establishing beings in the pure buddhafields.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nyid nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nyid nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur pa yin zhing /
translated: If the bodhisattva were to become definitely destined for perfect complete enlightenment from the very first production of the thought,

original: nges pa ji ltar na ngan song du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa ji ltar na ngan song du skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are born in the lower realms?

original: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Those who generate the mind of complete enlightenment

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang tshad med pa bzhi la spyod cing mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spang ba'i phyir gnas pa de dag la mi khom pa brgyad kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang tshad med pa bzhi la spyod cing mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spang ba'i phyir gnas pa de dag la mi khom pa brgyad kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: and practice the six perfections and four immeasurables and abide in order to abandon the ten nonvirtuous actions do not even have the eight opportunities for leisure.🔽What need is there to mention that they are born in the lower realms?

original: ngan song du @214b skye ba lta smas kyang ci dgos de lta mod kyi 'on kyang de dag dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ngan song du @214b skye ba lta smas kyang ci dgos de lta mod kyi 'on kyang de dag dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pas /
translated: However, they are born in the animal realm, possessing all the roots of virtue with and without defilements,

original: sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis bsams bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis bsams bzhin du skye'o //
translated: and they are born intentionally through the power of benefiting sentient beings.

original: dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not experience the suffering of animals.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu dbang thob pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bdag nyid kyi ngo bo mtha' yas pa gzhan gyi don du cig car sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu dbang thob pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bdag nyid kyi ngo bo mtha' yas pa gzhan gyi don du cig car sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Tathāgata, having attained supreme mastery, simultaneously emanates infinite bodies for the sake of others in all world-realms.

original: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in the commitment to perfect enlightenment.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can gyi don mdzad kyang skyon gyis mi gos te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu sems can gyi don mdzad kyang skyon gyis mi gos te /
translated: he acts for the sake of beings in the ten directions, in world-realms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, without being defiled by faults.

original: 'di ltar gang reg pa dang / gang gis reg pa dang / gang la reg pa'i chos gsum po de dag 'di la mi dmigs shing stong pa nyid la dmigs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang reg pa dang / gang gis reg pa dang / gang la reg pa'i chos gsum po de dag 'di la mi dmigs shing stong pa nyid la dmigs na /
translated: For in this way, the three dharmas—that which touches, that by which it is touched, and that on which it is touched—are not apprehended by him, and he apprehends emptiness.

original: dkar po'i chos thams cad la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos thams cad la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: He abides in all wholesome dharmas,

original: de nyid kyis de dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in that very [apprehension of emptiness].

original: de ltar na chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi stong ste /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: des na stong pa nyid du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are included in emptiness.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi don tshad med pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi don tshad med pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing the benefit of limitless sentient beings.

original: de 'di ltar dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de 'di ltar dpyod par byed de /
translated: He analyzes it in the following way:

original: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: “All the tathāgatas who dwell in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: ming dang brda tsam kho nas brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: ming dang brda tsam kho nas brtags pa yin la /
translated: They are imputed by mere name and symbol.

original: btags pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: btags pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: And that imputation is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: If, on the other hand, something existed,
