original: mi stong par gyur na gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi stong par gyur na gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: it would not be empty. Because it is not limited,

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa kho na ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa kho na ste /
translated: all phenomena are empty of all phenomena.

original: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas mngon par shes pa drug bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas mngon par shes pa drug bsgrubs te /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom, he accomplishes the six superknowledges.

original: gang dag la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'gro zhing bsnyen bkur byas te /🔽de dag la chos mnyan pa de dag las kyang mngon par zhin pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing stong pa nyid la @215a * //
analyzed: gang dag la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'gro zhing bsnyen bkur byas te / de dag la chos mnyan pa de dag las kyang mngon par zhin pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing stong pa nyid la @215a * //
translated: Abiding in these, they go into the presence of all the Tathagatas in the ten directions and serve them.

original: mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: And from them they hear the Dharma, and they plant the roots of virtue without attachment, and they do not cling to emptiness.

original: des lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams la bltas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas der song ste /
analyzed: des lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams la bltas nas rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas der song ste /
translated: With the divine eye they see the sentient beings in the world-realms of the ten directions, and with the superknowledge of magical power they go there

original: de dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: de dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: and teach them the Dharma.

original: lha'i rna bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos ston pa thos nas de dag la ston par byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rna bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos ston pa thos nas de dag la ston par byed do //
translated: With the divine ear they hear the Dharma teachings of all the Buddhas in the ten directions, and they teach them.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rnam grangs shes par byas nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rnam grangs shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the various thoughts of sentient beings,

original: sems ji lta ba bzhin du de dag la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems ji lta ba bzhin du de dag la chos ston par byed do //
translated: they teach them the Dharma in accordance with their thoughts.

original: des bdag dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
analyzed: des bdag dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
translated: He remembers his own and others’ many past lives.

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran nas /
translated: He remembers the Dharma taught by the former Tathāgatas.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i sems gang yin pa dag la de ston par byed do //🔽des zag pa zad pa shes pas sems can rnams la rjes su mthun par chos ston to //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i sems gang yin pa dag la de ston par byed do // des zag pa zad pa shes pas sems can rnams la rjes su mthun par chos ston to //
translated: He teaches it to those disciples who are ready to be trained.🔽By knowing the extinction of the pollutants, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in a way that is appropriate for them.

original: des mngon par shes pa dag gis sems can rnams kyi don du bdag nyid kyi dngos po gang dang gang gzung bar 'dod pa de dang / de nyid so sor len par byed par 'dod do //
analyzed: des mngon par shes pa dag gis sems can rnams kyi don du bdag nyid kyi dngos po gang dang gang gzung bar 'dod pa de dang / de nyid so sor len par byed par 'dod do //
translated: By means of the superknowledges, he takes up whatever form he wishes for the sake of sentient beings.

original: der yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas mi gos so //
analyzed: der yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bas mi gos so //
translated: And he is not defiled by the happiness and suffering of that.

original: 'di ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bstan pa la sogs pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so//
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bstan pa la sogs pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so//
translated: This is his deed of establishing in the teachings of the Buddhas of the ten directions, etc.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s branch of enlightenment?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang // bsam gtan bzhi nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang // bsam gtan bzhi nas /
translated: The six perfections, the four concentrations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar te /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag la spyod na 'khor gsum dag pas de dag la yang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: de dag la spyod na 'khor gsum dag pas de dag la yang mi dmigs shing /
translated: When practicing those, through the purity of the three spheres, one does not even observe those,

original: bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad kyi mchog gi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / sems can thams cad kyi mchog gi don du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: and one dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of the highest aim of all sentient beings.

original: gal te 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
translated: If these are the bodhisattva’s attributes,

original: de lta na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what are the buddhas’ attributes?

original: gal te 'di dag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: If, through these, one fully awakens to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur zhing skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'di nyid de /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur zhing skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'di nyid de /
translated: and abandons all the connections with propensities, and through the wisdom that is possessed for one moment fully awakens to all dharmas,🔽that is it.

original: de lta bu byang chub sems @215b dpa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu byang chub sems @215b dpa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi yan lag la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi yan lag la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s activity of establishing the factors of awakening.

original: ji ltar yang chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa de lta mod kyi las kyang yod /
analyzed: ji ltar yang chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa de lta mod kyi las kyang yod /
translated: Even though all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, there is still karma,

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yang yod de /
translated: and there are still the effects of karma.

original: sems can rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams mi shes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams mi shes so //
translated: Sentient beings do not understand that phenomena are empty of their own characteristics.

original: mi shes pas chos dang gang zag tu btags nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed cing nye bar spyod pas ngan song gsum du 'gro bar byed la legs par spyod pas lha dang mir skye ba yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pas chos dang gang zag tu btags nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed cing nye bar spyod pas ngan song gsum du 'gro bar byed la legs par spyod pas lha dang mir skye ba yin no //
translated: Because of their lack of understanding, they impute persons and phenomena, and they engage in virtuous and nonvirtuous karma. Because of this engagement, they go to the three lower realms. Because of good engagement, they are born as gods and humans.

original: yang kha cig ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par yongs su shes nas /
translated: Some, having fully understood the selflessness of persons and phenomena,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro yongs su spangs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro yongs su spangs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do /
translated: attain nirvāṇa, because they have abandoned both happy and miserable realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having completed the virtuous qualities such as the perfections,

original: rim gyis sa bcu thob par byas te /
analyzed: rim gyis sa bcu thob par byas te /
translated: gradually attains the ten grounds,

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: and with the wisdom that is possessed for one instant, fully and completely awakens to all phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes a buddha, a Bhagavan.

original: 'di ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi zha ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa chud mi zha ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is his activity of establishing the unbroken connection between karma and its effects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa dang / bden pa mthong bas mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa dang / bden pa mthong bas mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, who has seen the truth, does not pass into nirvana.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: However, he sees the equality of the four truths.

original: gang de dag de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing ngo bo nyid med pas des chos gang yang dmigs pa med cing bden pa'i rnam grangs kyis rlom sems su mi byed la /
analyzed: gang de dag de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing ngo bo nyid med pas des chos gang yang dmigs pa med cing bden pa'i rnam grangs kyis rlom sems su mi byed la /
translated: Since they are the same in suchness and have no essence, he does not observe any phenomena with that and does not falsely project the enumeration of the truths.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
translated: Therefore, having seen all phenomena as emptiness,🔽he does not pass into nirvana.

original: skyon med pa la zhugs te rigs kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyon med pa la zhugs te rigs kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They enter into the faultless and abide in the stage of lineage.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de /
translated: They generate the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: des 'dir zhi gnas kyi sa la gnas par byas nas /
analyzed: des 'dir zhi gnas kyi sa la gnas par byas nas /
translated: Here, having stabilized the level of serenity,

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byed /
translated: they fully understand suffering,

original: kun 'byung spong bar byed /
analyzed: kun 'byung spong bar byed /
translated: abandon its origination,

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byed /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byed /
translated: manifest its cessation,

original: lam sgom par byed kyang /
analyzed: lam sgom par byed kyang /
translated: and cultivate the path.

original: bden pa la dmigs pa'i sems skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: bden pa la dmigs pa'i sems skyed par mi byed /
translated: But they do not generate the mind focused on the truths.

original: byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kho nas @216a * //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhol ba'i sems kho nas @216a * // rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: With a mind solely intent on Awakening,🔽they see all phenomena as empty of intrinsic identity.

original: des lhag mthong gi chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
analyzed: des lhag mthong gi chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong nas /
translated: Having seen all phenomena as empty through insight,

original: thabs la mkhas pas kyang chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas kyang chos ston par byed do //
translated: they teach the doctrine with skillful means.

original: 'di ni bden pa bzhi mthong ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa bzhi mthong ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the evolutionary action that establishes the vision of the four noble truths.

original: byams pas gsal ba /
analyzed: byams pas gsal ba /
translated: The Clear Words

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are by nature non-existent,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslab par bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la bslab par bgyi ba lags /
translated: how can bodhisattvas train in form up to the buddhadharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming tsam nyid do zhes bka' stsal pa dang / gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ming tsam nyid do zhes bka' stsal pa dang / gsol pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “It is merely a name.”

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po dngos po med pa'i ming ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po dngos po med pa'i ming ni ming tsam mo //
translated: The name of the non-existence of the entity of the sign of formations is merely a name.

original: 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Formations are conceptualization.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni yul te /🔽gang la 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni yul te / gang la 'di ltar 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Their sign is the object.🔽With regard to that, it is thought that “this is form,”

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba nas 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar du dgongs so //
translated: up to “these are the buddhadharmas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ming tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du btags pa ste /
analyzed: ming tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du btags pa ste /
translated: “It is merely a name.” This is a temporary designation.

original: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ming tha dad pas ming gi don du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ming tha dad pas ming gi don du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one understands the meaning of the name as a separate name, up to “this is form.”

original: de'i phyir sgra'i don ni brdzun te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i don ni brdzun te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word is false.

original: tha snyad tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam yin gyi /
translated: It is mere convention.

original: dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a real entity.

original: gsol pa / gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid tha snyad tsam nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid tha snyad tsam nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Śāriputra said, “The intrinsic nature of form is mere convention.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
translated: “There is no arising or ceasing in that.

original: de bas na de rang gi ngo bo med do //🔽gsol pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de bas na de rang gi ngo bo med do // gsol pa yang bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa nas /
translated: Therefore, it has no intrinsic nature.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yod pa lags sam zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yod pa lags sam zhes so //
translated: Śāriputra said, “Bhagavān, is the intrinsic nature of all things, from form up to consciousness, up to the buddhadharmas, completely and totally nonexistent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad du yod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi brda dang tha snyad du yod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: “They exist as worldly conventions and designations, but not ultimately.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, according to my understanding of what the Blessed One has said,

original: don dam brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings nyid de /
analyzed: don dam brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings nyid de /
translated: the ultimate is the inexpressible realm.

original: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags te tha snyad kyang @216b 'di nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po brjod du ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags te tha snyad kyang @216b 'di nyid do //
translated: If conditioned things with characteristics are the inexpressible realm, then this is just a convention.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nam khyod brjod du med pa'i dbyings la shes rab spyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nam khyod brjod du med pa'i dbyings la shes rab spyod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: “When you engage in the practice of wisdom in the inexpressible realm,

original: dmigs pa 'di nyid kyi rnam pa ni mtshan ma'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'di nyid kyi rnam pa ni mtshan ma'i dngos po'o //
translated: the aspect of this observation is a thing with characteristics.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
translated: ” He said, “Blessed One, it is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,

original: 'di ltar de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyang ma yin gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyang ma yin gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: “It is precisely for this reason that it is neither that nor something else.

original: gal te gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ci'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur ji ste gzhan ma yin na ni ci'i phyir mi dmigs /
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin par gyur na ni de ci'i phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur ji ste gzhan ma yin na ni ci'i phyir mi dmigs /
translated: If it were something else, why would it not be destroyed? If it were not something else, why is it not observed?

original: gzhan yang gal te 'di 'du byed kyi mtshan ma las gzhan yin par gyur na ni de lta na byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'di 'du byed kyi mtshan ma las gzhan yin par gyur na ni de lta na byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing /
translated: Moreover, if this were other than the signs of formative predispositions, then all ordinary foolish beings would attain complete nirvana.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And they would fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: ji ste gzhan ma yin par gyur na yang /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan ma yin par gyur na yang /
translated: But if it were not other,

original: de ltar na mtshan ma de yang dmigs su med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan ma de yang dmigs su med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then those signs would not be apprehended.

original: gsol pa / brjod du med pa'i dbyings dang / nye bar 'brel ba'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: gsol pa / brjod du med pa'i dbyings dang / nye bar 'brel ba'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa na /
translated: He replied, “When one abides in the domain of inexpressibility and the conduct of wisdom,

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang la dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gang la dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: if the entities that are the signs of formative predispositions are not apprehended,🔽is it because they exist and are not apprehended,

original: de ci lags mchis pa las dmigs su ma mchis sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ci lags mchis pa las dmigs su ma mchis sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: or is it because they do not exist and are not apprehended?”

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pas gzung zhing rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pas gzung zhing rtogs pa'am /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “When they are apprehended and realized by conceptual thought,

original: ma rtogs pa de'i tshe ni de rnam par rtog pa tsam mo //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa de'i tshe ni de rnam par rtog pa tsam mo //
translated: or when they are not realized, then they are mere conceptual thoughts.

original: de la 'di ni yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa dus chos yongs su gdags par bgyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam pa dus chos yongs su gdags par bgyi /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, in how many ways is a dharma imputed?”

original: byams pa rnam pa gsum gyis te /
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa gsum gyis te /
translated: “Maitreya, in three ways:🔽imagined form,

original: 'di ltar kun du brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun du brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
translated: conceptual form, and the form of reality.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du kun du brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos so //🔽de la gang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang gdags pa dang tha snyad du bya ba la brten nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du kun du brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos so // de la gang 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming dang gdags pa dang tha snyad du bya ba la brten nas /
translated: In the same way, there are imagined buddha qualities, conceptual buddha qualities, and the buddha qualities of reality.🔽Among them, imagined form is the essential nature of form that is imagined on the basis of the name, designation, and convention of the thing that is the sign of the compounded.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Conceptual form is the essential nature of form that is imagined on the basis of the name, designation, and convention of the thing that is the sign of the compounded.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de dag la gnas pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so //🔽kun @217a * //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de dang de dag la gnas pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs so // kun @217a * //
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: du brtags pa'i gzugs gang yin pa des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de la /
analyzed: du brtags pa'i gzugs gang yin pa des rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de la /
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the imagined form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: dus rtag tu ngo bo nyid med cing bdag med pa dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: dus rtag tu ngo bo nyid med cing bdag med pa dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the imagined form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: de bzhin du kun du brtags pa'i gzugs nas //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun du brtags pa'i gzugs nas //
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the imagined form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang sbyar ro //🔽de la yongs su brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su med do //🔽rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su yod de /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang sbyar ro // de la yongs su brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su med do // rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni rdzas su yod de /
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the imagined form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod par blta'i rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rdzas su yod par blta'i rang dbang du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the imagined form.🔽The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the dependent form.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rdzas med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rdzas med pa yang ma yin /
translated: The form that is the basis of the signs of compositional activity is the reality form.

original: rdzas yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not substantially existent,

original: chos nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: but is distinguished by reality.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The same is true of the other dharmas up to the Buddhadharmas.

original: gsol pa / gang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / gang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Śāriputra said, “The Bhagavat has said,

original: gang 'di ltar gzugs gnyis su ma mchis par bgrang ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar gzugs gnyis su ma mchis par bgrang ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‘The two aspects of form are not two aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du de ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du de ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ’ Up to the Buddhadharmas, how is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Bhagavat said,

original: gang yongs su brtags pa'i gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yongs su brtags pa'i gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
translated: “The form that is imagined is not form,

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang gzugs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang gzugs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unreal and is not even conventionally form.

original: gang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
translated: The form that is discriminated is not form,

original: rang dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs ma yin pa rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gzugs ma yin pa rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not independent.🔽It is the imagined form of that which is not form.

original: gang chos nyid kyi gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang chos nyid kyi gzugs de ni gzugs ma yin te /
translated: The form that is the reality of form is not form,🔽because it is the object of the ultimate wisdom of the noble ones.

original: gzugs kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the emptiness of form.

original: gzugs ma yin pa yang don dam pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa yang don dam pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also because of the ultimate reality of form.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su bgrangs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i grangs su bgrangs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, this is reckoned as a non-dual number, up to the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: gsol pa / de ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pas /
analyzed: gsol pa / de ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la zhugs pas /
translated: Subhūti said: Having thus avoided the two extremes, one enters the middle way.

original: gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag ji ltar mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa dang / mtshan nyid spangs pa dang / mtshan nyid mngon du bgyi ba dang / ji ltar mtshan nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag ji ltar mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa dang / mtshan nyid spangs pa dang / mtshan nyid mngon du bgyi ba dang / ji ltar mtshan nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: How does one understand the characteristics of form, up to the dharmas of the Buddha, abandon the characteristics, manifest the characteristics, and cultivate the characteristics?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gang @217b gzugs yongs su shes pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gang @217b gzugs yongs su shes pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin pa de nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa yang ma yin pa de nyid de'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: That which is neither fully understood nor not fully understood in form, that is its full understanding.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa yang ma yin mi bsgom pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa yang ma yin mi bsgom pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Similarly, it is neither cultivated nor not cultivated, up to

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied up to the Buddha-dharmas.

original: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang lags /
translated: Śāriputra asked, “What is the nirvāṇa of the bodhisattva who possesses such thorough knowledge?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zab bo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zab bo //
translated: “Nirvāṇa is profound.”

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de ji ltar zab ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa de ji ltar zab ce na /
translated: Why is nirvāṇa profound?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas 'khor ba yongs su gtong pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽bdag gi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi don las brtsams nas 'khor ba yongs su gtong pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // bdag gi don las brtsams te /
translated: Because nirvāṇa is the relinquishment of saṃsāra that is undertaken for the sake of others.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma gtang ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma gtang ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Because nirvāṇa is the non-relinquishment of saṃsāra that is undertaken for the sake of oneself.

original: gcig ma btang na cig shos btang ba ni rigs kyi /
analyzed: gcig ma btang na cig shos btang ba ni rigs kyi /
translated: If one relinquishes one, it is reasonable to relinquish the other.

original: gnyi ga ma btang na ni mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma btang na ni mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: But if one does not relinquish both, it is unreasonable.

original: gnyi ga la rnam par mi rtog pas /
analyzed: gnyi ga la rnam par mi rtog pas /
translated: Because of non-conceptuality with regard to both,

original: gnyi ga la yang mi skyo ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang mi skyo ste /
translated: one is not discouraged with regard to either.

original: de bas na gnyi ga yongs su ma btang ba yang rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga yongs su ma btang ba yang rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is also reasonable that neither is completely abandoned.

original: de ltar na de ni 'khor bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'khor bar yang 'gyur /
translated: In that case, it is not reasonable that he would be in cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gyur bar yang mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gyur bar yang mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: nor would it be reasonable that he would be in nirvana.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems la dbang thob cing thabs la mkhas pas 'khor ba bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems la dbang thob cing thabs la mkhas pas 'khor ba bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: Because the bodhisattva who has attained mastery of mind and is skilled in means manifests cyclic existence, he does not completely abandon cyclic existence.

original: gang stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi gtong ngo //
translated: Because he abides in the nonapprehension of emptiness, he does not abandon nirvana.

original: gsol pa / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
translated: Subhūti said, “How should one view all the characteristics of nonconceptuality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / gang yang de dag gi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa dang / gang yang spros pa med pa 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang / de dag gi stong pa nyid dang / gang yang de dag gi dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa dang / gang yang spros pa med pa 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of all non-conceptuality is this: all phenomena such as form, their emptiness, their existence, and their non-existence as two are non-dual, and they are also free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One, is it the case that

original: nyan thos thams cad phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa lags /
analyzed: nyan thos thams cad phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa lags /
translated: all hearers attain a one-sided nirvāṇa?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: 'jig rten dag ni khams sna tshogs pa /🔽sems can gyi rigs dang / rang bzhin rab tu mang po yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag ni khams sna tshogs pa / sems can gyi rigs dang / rang bzhin rab tu mang po yod de /
translated: “The world has various elements.

original: rigs dang / @218a * //🔽rus dang po nas /
analyzed: rigs dang / @218a * // rus dang po nas /
translated: There are many different types of sentient beings, with many different natures.🔽Some desire a good type,🔽a good family line,

original: bzang po'i khyad par 'dod cing de dag thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bzang po'i khyad par 'dod cing de dag thob pa yang yod do //
translated: and they attain that.🔽Some desire a bad type,

original: khyad par ngan pa 'dod cing de nyid thob pas /
analyzed: khyad par ngan pa 'dod cing de nyid thob pas /
translated: and they attain just that.

original: de nyid kyis mgu bar 'gyur ba yang yod de //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mgu bar 'gyur ba yang yod de //
translated: They are satisfied with just that.

original: nyan thos dgra bcom pa phyis bzang po'i khyad par 'dod cing byang chub tu bsngos nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dgra bcom pa phyis bzang po'i khyad par 'dod cing byang chub tu bsngos nas /
translated: The śrāvaka arhat, who wishes for a special good rebirth, dedicates to enlightenment and

original: yun ring po nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do //
analyzed: yun ring po nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do //
translated: causes the attainment of perfect enlightenment after a long time.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir skye ba na /
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir skye ba na /
translated: In order to attain that, he is reborn,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the power of karma and afflictions.

original: 'on kyang dgra bcom pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye bar gdags te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dgra bcom pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye bar gdags te /
translated: However, the arhat who has attained nirvāṇa is designated as an inconceivable rebirth.

original: gang de la dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs dang rus so //
analyzed: gang de la dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs dang rus so //
translated: Among them, the first is the family and clan of the bodhisattvas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa rgya che ba dang / bdag nyid chen po bsam pa ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa rgya che ba dang / bdag nyid chen po bsam pa ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: He said, Blessed One, the intention of the bodhisattvas is vast and their greatness is inconceivable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽It is so.

original: gang 'di brgya byin nyid dang / 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi 'dod cing gang yang de dag la chags pa med cing 'dzin pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rgya che ba'i bsam
analyzed: gang 'di brgya byin nyid dang / 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi 'dod cing gang yang de dag la chags pa med cing 'dzin pa med par dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni rgya che ba'i bsam
translated: The magnanimous intention is that of not desiring the worldly perfections of Indra, guardian of the world, universal monarch, and so on, but of dedicating the roots of virtue to unsurpassed enlightenment without attachment or clinging.

original: pa'o // gang yang de chags pa med pa'i bde ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i bde ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: pa'o // gang yang de chags pa med pa'i bde ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i bde ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thams cad sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: The intention of greatness is that of wishing to share with all sentient beings the happiness of nonattachment, the happiness of nonclinging, and the happiness of nirvana.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed cing 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bas /
translated: And, without abandoning samsara, one dedicates the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ni de dag gi bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the intention of greatness.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos so //
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, this is the marvelous and wonderful Dharma of the bodhisattvas.

original: de thob par 'dod pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de thob par 'dod pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: Those who wish to attain it should give rise to the mind set on unsurpassed awakening.”

original: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor gyis gsol pa chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor gyis gsol pa chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: Then Subhūti said, “If all phenomena are essentially unreal,

original: ji ltar las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag ce na /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag ce na / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: how are actions and their results established?”

original: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma shes sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma shes sam /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Do you not understand the essential unreality of all phenomena?

original: sems can rnams phyin ci log las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par @218b rtog pa las byas nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams phyin ci log las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par @218b rtog pa las byas nas /
translated: Sentient beings, arising from error, create concepts,

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par byed do //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu thob par byed do //
translated: and then experience the results of their actions in accordance with their actions.

original: de la phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four errors:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dngos po la mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dngos po la mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of persons, the selflessness of things, and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'dir byams pas zhus pa'i lan gyis phyin ci log mang po yang bsal cing rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan gyis phyin ci log mang po yang bsal nas /
analyzed: 'dir byams pas zhus pa'i lan gyis phyin ci log mang po yang bsal cing rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan gyis phyin ci log mang po yang bsal nas /
translated: Here, having cleared up many errors in the answer to Maitreya's question, and having cleared up many errors in the answer to Subhuti's question,

original: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan cung zad kyang bsal ba 'di ni phyin ci log spong ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan cung zad kyang bsal ba 'di ni phyin ci log spong ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: this clearing up of even a little of the answer to Subhuti's question is the action of setting forth the abandonment of error.

original: sems can rnams phyin ci log rnams las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams phyin ci log rnams las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Sentient beings form formations from errors.

original: de las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi /
analyzed: de las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi /
translated: From that, there is the afflictive life-cycle, and that is in terms of worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: but not in terms of the ultimate.

original: gang du gnas pa'i las kyi bya ba'i dngos po skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gzhag pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du gnas pa'i las kyi bya ba'i dngos po skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam gzhag pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no entity of the action of the activity of abiding anywhere, not even to the extent of the tip of a hair.

original: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi med par shes pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log bzhi med par shes pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the evolutionary action of establishing the understanding of the four errors.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: The equality of all things, the suchness, the reality-limit, and nirvana, are also just worldly conventions, not ultimate.

original: brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par byang ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par byang ba la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Because they are inexpressible. This is the evolutionary action of establishing purification.

original: chos thams cad gzhi med cing rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzhi med cing rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin pa de lta mod kyi /
translated: Although all things are baseless, like a dream and an illusion,

original: de ma shes pas sems can mngon par zhen cing las byas nas bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma shes pas sems can mngon par zhen cing las byas nas bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror 'gyur te /
translated: nevertheless, because of not knowing that, sentient beings, having created karma through attachment, go to good and bad destinies.

original: des na de dag gi phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de dag gi phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate their error,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems pa chen pos byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems pa chen pos byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: the bodhisattva, the great being, generates the will for enlightenment.

original: tshogs rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: tshogs rnams la spyod cing /
translated: He practices the perfections,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas /
translated: and after he has fully awakened to highest genuine full Awakening,🔽he brings about the full evolution of living beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i bar 'di ni tshogs la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i bar 'di ni tshogs la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of setting forth the perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said,

original: gnyis kyis kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med /
analyzed: gnyis kyis kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med /
translated: “There is no realization through duality,🔽and there is no realization through nonduality.

original: gnyis med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa 'di nyid ni gang la gnyis med pa dang / gnyis med pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o//
analyzed: gnyis med pas kyang mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa 'di nyid ni gang la gnyis med pa dang / gnyis med pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o//
translated: This is the nonduality and the realization of nonduality.

original: @219a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @219a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang 'di mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'di mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa ste /
translated: ‘This is realization’ is a fabrication.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid la spros pa med de /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid la spros pa med de /
translated: Dharma-equality is without fabrication.

original: spros pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Non-fabrication is equality.

original: de nyid chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de nyid chos thams cad do //
translated: That itself is all dharmas.

original: de nyid so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: de nyid so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag go //
translated: That itself is all ordinary persons and noble persons.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog go //
translated: That is the Jewel of the Buddha, the Jewel of the Dharma, and the Jewel of the Saṅgha.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni chos nyid de /
translated: Equality is the true nature of dharmas.

original: chos nyid la yang tha dad pa ni med do //
analyzed: chos nyid la yang tha dad pa ni med do //
translated: And there is no difference in the true nature of dharmas.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽ci chos nyid 'dus bgyis pa lags sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / ci chos nyid 'dus bgyis pa lags sam /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
translated: “Is the true nature of dharmas compounded or uncompounded?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: The Lord said,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin no //
translated: “It is neither compounded nor uncompounded.”

original: gang yang 'dus byas kyi khams dang / gang yang 'dus ma byas kyi khams 'di gnyi ga ldan pa yang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'dus byas kyi khams dang / gang yang 'dus ma byas kyi khams 'di gnyi ga ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “The compounded element and the uncompounded element are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa mtshan nyid gcig pa ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa mtshan nyid gcig pa ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: They are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have only one mark—that is, no mark.

original: 'di ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos tha dad pa med par shes pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos tha dad pa med par shes pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the deed of establishing the knowledge of the nondifferentiation of compounded and uncompounded dharmas.”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas /
translated: They are not made by the hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: not made by the solitary buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpas ma byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ma byas /
translated: not made by the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ma byas te /
translated: and not made by the buddhas.

original: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: And that which is empty of an intrinsic essence is nirvana.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing in nirvana.

original: mdzad pa'i khyad par nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos thams cad 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya ste //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i khyad par nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos thams cad 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya ste //
translated: In order to teach just the distinctive activity, it says, The perfection of wisdom should be known to be unperturbed because all phenomena are unperturbed.

original: mdzad pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Activity is conduct.

original: spyod pa ni chos te /
analyzed: spyod pa ni chos te /
translated: Conduct is Dharma.

original: rig pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / dpe dang / ngo bo dang / chos shes pa'i tshig gis te chos thams cad mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po dag go //
analyzed: rig pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / dpe dang / ngo bo dang / chos shes pa'i tshig gis te chos thams cad mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po dag go //
translated: It is the twenty-seven activities of knowing, non-violence, examples, essence, and Dharma, with the words.

original: de 'khrug pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de 'khrug pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Its non-disturbance is its non-injury.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis gnod pa ji lta ba zhin du rgyun mi 'chad par nam mkha' snyed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis gnod pa ji lta ba zhin du rgyun mi 'chad par nam mkha' snyed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is uninterrupted in all ways, to the extent of space, for all sentient beings dwelling in the world-realms of the ten directions.

original: @219b de skyed par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las so //🔽rgya mtsho mu med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: @219b de skyed par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang 'khrug pa med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las so // rgya mtsho mu med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Bhagavat's generation of that should be known as the perfection of wisdom's non-disturbance. This is the Dharma Body's activity.

original: chos thams cad 'khrug pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gang dag gsungs nas /🔽de dag don dam par shes pa rim bzhin du bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'khrug pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par gang dag gsungs nas / de dag don dam par shes pa rim bzhin du bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: The passage from the ocean is limitless up to all phenomena are non-disturbance teaches the distinctive qualities of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dris te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dris te /
translated: Desiring to teach those in order, in terms of the ultimate, he asks, Why is that?

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi sku dang 'brel pa'i rtog pa'i tshig gang gsungs pa de dag thams cad kyi gtan tshigs ni gang ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi sku dang 'brel pa'i rtog pa'i tshig gang gsungs pa de dag thams cad kyi gtan tshigs ni gang ste /
translated: The reason for all those statements of the word of realization connected with the Dharma Body is what?

original: rgyu gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: what is the cause?

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni len te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni len te /
translated: Subhuti, form, etc. is taken up.

original: 'dir rgya mtsho mu med pa ni stong pa nyid tsam yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir rgya mtsho mu med pa ni stong pa nyid tsam yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Here, the endless ocean is just emptiness.

original: de yang tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is immeasurable.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga yang rgya mtsho dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga yang rgya mtsho dang mtshungs so //
translated: In the same way, the five aggregates beginning with form are like an ocean.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like that.

original: de ltar gang yang gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang yang de dag gis stong pa nyid dang / gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar gang yang gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang yang de dag gis stong pa nyid dang / gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, whatever is form, etc., whatever is emptiness of those, and whatever is the perfection of wisdom, all of these are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: unmanifested, and of one mark,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: which is to say, of no mark.

original: gzugs ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs pa'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba nas mi dmigs pa'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Form is like space, and so on up to: unapprehendable.

original: mi dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: Unapprehendability is non-afflicted non-knowing.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad le'u dang bcas par bstan pa de ltar rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar na mngon par rtogs pa brgyad le'u dang bcas par bstan pa de ltar rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, etc. means: just as the eight realizations with their chapters have been taught, so should one understand them.

original: rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand them.

original: ci zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What should be done?

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated: When, Subhūti, etc.

original: rjes su rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i tshogs kyis nyan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i tshogs kyis nyan par byed pa'o //
translated: One should understand means one should listen with the collection of letters.

original: rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bos so //
translated: “Investigation” is by way of the nature of the object.

original: 'jug pa dang rtog par byed pa zhes bya bas ni rab tu shes par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang rtog par byed pa zhes bya bas ni rab tu shes par byed pas so //
translated: “Engaging and conceiving” is by way of understanding.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas @220a * //
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas @220a * //
translated: Endowed with four kinds of reasoning,

original: 'di lta bu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes sems pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes sems pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: one thinks, “It is just like this, not otherwise,” and that is reflection.

original: yang byis pa nus pa zad pas skyo pa dang / smyos pa dang / brgyal ba'am /
analyzed: yang byis pa nus pa zad pas skyo pa dang / smyos pa dang / brgyal ba'am /
translated: Moreover, the childish, exhausted by their abilities, are discouraged, and are insane, or faint, or

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de dag mi bsam par gang yang gnas la sems pa de dag ni 'jal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de dag mi bsam par gang yang gnas la sems pa de dag ni 'jal bar byed pa'o //
translated: die. Those who do not think about those situations, but think about something else, are measuring.

original: ji ltar 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dam pas gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dam pas gzigs pa ste /
translated: Just as these are seen by the Blessed One, the supreme lord of yoga,

original: bdag gis ni 'di dag bsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis ni 'di dag bsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: I should not think about them,

original: rtog pa can gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa can gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because they are the domain of the conceptual.” This is investigation.

original: 'di lta bu'i the tshom thams cad chad pa'i phyir 'di ni yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i the tshom thams cad chad pa'i phyir 'di ni yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: In order to cut off all such doubts, one should hold to the ascertainment that this is the way it is.

original: de ltar the tshom thams cad shin tu chad na /
analyzed: de ltar the tshom thams cad shin tu chad na /
translated: When all doubts are thus cut off,

original: sgom pa la dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgom pa la dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: one becomes powerful in meditation.

original: de'i phyir sgom par 'gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgom par 'gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one will meditate.

original: sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi te /
analyzed: sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi te /
translated: Meditation is of four kinds:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / de gnyi ga dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / de gnyi ga dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: calmness, insight, both of them, and delight in calmness and insight.

original: ji lta bur yid la byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur yid la byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mental attention?

original: sgyu dang g-yo thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: It is said that all deceit and craftiness, etc.

original: bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la /
translated: All attachment to the self, to the possession, to form, to feeling, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa thams cad ni rlom sems thams cad do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa thams cad ni rlom sems thams cad do //
translated: is all conceit.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad dang / bdud la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa gang bskyod pa ni thams cad bskul ba'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad dang / bdud la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa gang bskyod pa ni thams cad bskul ba'o //
translated: All adversaries, demons, etc., and afflictions are agitated.

original: de'i tshe de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, at that time, etc.

original: yon tan thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan no //
translated: All virtues are the virtues of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba ni yon tan no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba ni yon tan no //
translated: The buddha-field is the virtue.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gyur pa ste /
translated: The perfection is the transformation.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mdo'i don ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad de /
analyzed: mdo'i don ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad de /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is the eight realizations.

original: bstan bcos kyi dang por bstan nas /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi dang por bstan nas /
translated: Having been taught at the beginning of the treatise,

original: de rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad do //
translated: they are explained in detail.

original: yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos las /
translated: Again, in the treatise,

original: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
translated: The characteristics, the application to that, the excellence of that, the sequence of that, the culmination of that, the evolutionary maturity of that,

original: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are another condensation of the meaning, in six topics.

original: yang na mdo'i don ni drug ste /
analyzed: yang na mdo'i don ni drug ste /
translated: Or else, the meaning of the sutra is sixfold:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid @220b gsum po 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid @220b gsum po 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: These are the characteristics of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Because it has three aspects.

original: bzhi pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the clear realization of all aspects.

original: 'di ni de la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de la sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application.

original: lnga pa rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i rab po //
analyzed: lnga pa rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i rab po //
translated: The fifth is the clear realization of the peak. This is the highest application.

original: drug pa mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i go rims te /
analyzed: drug pa mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i go rims te /
translated: The sixth is the clear realization of the serial. This is the sequential order of application.

original: mthar gyis sbyor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthar gyis sbyor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the application is sequential.

original: bdun pa skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the clear realization in one instant. This is the culmination of application.

original: brgyad pa chos kyi sku 'di ni de'i rnam par smin pa ste 'bras bu'i gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brgyad pa chos kyi sku 'di ni de'i rnam par smin pa ste 'bras bu'i gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eighth is the Dharma body. This is its full ripening, meaning the principal result.

original: yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos las /
translated: Again, the treatise says:

original: yul gyi rgyu ni gsum dag dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: yul gyi rgyu ni gsum dag dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
translated: the result is the Dharma body and activity.

original: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //
translated: The other summary is threefold.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yang na mdo'i don ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na mdo'i don ni gsum ste /
translated: Or, the meaning of the sutra is threefold:

original: rgyu dang / sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: cause, application, and result.

original: de la sbyor ba'i yul ni rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i yul ni rgyu rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the object of application is the threefold cause:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: the knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of paths, and the knowledge of all things.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir bzhi ni sbyor ba'i don te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir bzhi ni sbyor ba'i don te /
translated: The four applications are the meaning of application, because they are not common to others:

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: realization of all aspects, culminating realization, serial realization, and single instant realization.

original: chos kyi sku ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The Dharma body is the result.

original: phrin las dang zhes bya ba'i sgra med kyang gang gi don du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phrin las dang zhes bya ba'i sgra med kyang gang gi don du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Although the word “activity” is not present, it should be understood as the purpose of that.

original: don bsdus ni mdo'i don rnams bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: don bsdus ni mdo'i don rnams bsdus pa ste /
translated: The summary is the summary of the topics of the sūtra.

original: de la dang po ni brgyad do //
analyzed: de la dang po ni brgyad do //
translated: Among them, the first is eightfold.

original: gnyis pa ni drug go //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni drug go //
translated: The second is sixfold.

original: gsum pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The third is threefold.

original: rjes su rig par byed pa'i tshig gi le'u ni rjes su rig pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig par byed pa'i tshig gi le'u ni rjes su rig pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that causes understanding is the chapter of understanding.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
translated: This completes the twenty-ninth chapter of Supreme Essence, the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines composed by the master Ratnākaraśānti.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po de ji ltar btsal bar bya ba de ma gsungs te /
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad po de ji ltar btsal bar bya ba de ma gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has not explained how to search for those eight realizations that he taught.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de 'chad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de 'chad par bzhed nas /
translated: Therefore, wishing to explain that,

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽yongs @221a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽yongs @221a * //
translated: the Blessed One said, “Moreover, Subhūti,” and so on.

original: su btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: su btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: “What is to be sought?” is the application of desire.

original: lus ngal ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa dgag pa ni brtson 'grus lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus ngal ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa dgag pa ni brtson 'grus lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The prohibition of attention to bodily fatigue, etc. is the meaning of “excessive effort.”

original: gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yang sems smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa'o //
translated: “Do not wish for anything at all” is the prohibition of distraction.

original: smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni zhen par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: smon par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni zhen par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not wish” means do not cling.

original: gang la yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “Anything at all” is the teaching.

original: nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “Inner and outer” is the explanation.

original: bdag gis dbang du byas pa'i don ni nang ste /
analyzed: bdag gis dbang du byas pa'i don ni nang ste /
translated: The meaning of “controlled by oneself” is inner.

original: rnam par dbye ba bdun pa'i zad par mi 'gyur pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba bdun pa'i zad par mi 'gyur pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The collection of the seven analyses is inexhaustible.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni phyi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni phyi'o //
translated: “Outer” is external.

original: ma byed cig pa ni song zhig pa dang sbyar ro //🔽g-yon dang gyas zhes bya ba ni logs zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ma byed cig pa ni song zhig pa dang sbyar ro // g-yon dang gyas zhes bya ba ni logs zhes dgongs so //
translated: “Do not make” is connected with “go.”🔽“Left and right” is intended as “side.”

original: shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs bstan to //
translated: “East,” etc. teach the directions.

original: phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba ni mtshams so //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba ni mtshams so //
translated: The “intermediate directions” are the directions between the cardinal directions.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang mtshams zhes bya bar zlos pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang mtshams zhes bya bar zlos pa'i don to //
translated: “Also” means that the cardinal and intermediate directions are repeated.
