analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs mtshan ma'i dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: detailed and thorough knowledge of confidence.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni de bzhin nyid de /🔽nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni de bzhin nyid de /🔽nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is the great compassion of a buddha.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par brgyan pa'i sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par brgyan pa'i sku ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't the body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor characteristics a Tathagata, not reality, etc.?

original: rigs kyi bu chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The son of good lineage, these dharmas... and so forth is stated.

original: de bzhin nyid kho na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kho na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes dgongs te /
translated: The thought is that only reality is the Tathagata who is completely pure.

original: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the reasoning that that is the essential body of those.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag tha ni dad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag tha ni dad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the difference between reality and the Tathagata,

original: shin tu tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to teach that they are not completely different, he says, the son of good lineage, these dharmas...

original: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: These dharmas are reality, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bos stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bos stong pa nyid do //
translated: Reality is emptiness with respect to the imagined nature.

original: chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: “All phenomena” refers to the aggregates, elements, and so on, up to the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “The one suchness” is the teaching.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “Son of noble family” and so on is the explanation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this.”

original: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs gsungs te //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtan tshigs gsungs te //
translated: “Because they do not exist” and so on are the stated reasons.

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is because they do not exist substantially.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du med pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du med pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is not because they do not exist in accordance with their characteristics.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa la byon pa dang / bzhud pa med par ni ji ltar btags pa ltar med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽dngos por rtogs pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa'i dpes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa la byon pa dang / bzhud pa med par ni ji ltar btags pa ltar med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // dngos por rtogs pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log pa la sogs pa'i dpes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the tathāgatas do not come or go because they do not exist as they are imagined.🔽In order to establish the realization of things as they are, the example of the mistaken perception and so on is given.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “It is like this.”

original: nyi ma gung gi dus la bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyi ma gung gi dus la bab pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
translated: At noontime.

original: 'di ni nyi ma gung yang yin la dus kyang yin pas nyi ma gung gi dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni nyi ma gung yang yin la dus kyang yin pas nyi ma gung gi dus so //
translated: This is noontime because it is both noon and a time.

original: de la bab pa 'ong ba na 'jug @225b pa'o //
analyzed: de la bab pa 'ong ba na 'jug @225b pa'o //
translated: When it has arrived, it has come.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs su mngon par chags par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gzugs su mngon par chags par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One who is attached to the Tathāgata as form, etc.

original: chos kyi sku ni chos nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni chos nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: The Dharma body is the body of reality.

original: glang po che'i tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la tshigs ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: An assemblage is a collection.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: Accomplishment is reality.

original: de ni brdzun pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir slu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni brdzun pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir slu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called “deceptive” because it is similar to a lie.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dge ba ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dge ba ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it is said to be “not good.”

original: don yod pa ni sbyin pa po'i 'bras bu chen po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod pa ni sbyin pa po'i 'bras bu chen po'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not nonexistent because it is the cause of the great result for the giver.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin gnas so //
translated: That is why it is a “worthy recipient.”

original: rab tu dbye ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The classification is the object.

original: sku mngon par 'grub pa ni srid pa tha ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sku mngon par 'grub pa ni srid pa tha ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The manifestation of the body is the last existence.

original: gang du 'gro ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i dus na ste /
translated: The going is at the time of parinirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i gnas ni gang na yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i gnas ni gang na yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no place where one goes to nirvana.

original: rgyu ni nye bar len pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni nye bar len pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is the appropriating cause.

original: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
translated: The condition is the cooperative cause.

original: de la sgra'i nye bar len pa ni sgra'i rdul phra rab bo zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de la sgra'i nye bar len pa ni sgra'i rdul phra rab bo zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that the appropriating cause of sound is the subtle particle of sound.

original: gzhan dag ni rlung gi rdul phra rab po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rlung gi rdul phra rab po zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the subtle particle of wind.

original: de la shing bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud dkri ba'i shing bu'o //
analyzed: de la shing bu zhes bya ba ni rgyud dkri ba'i shing bu'o //
translated: In this regard, the stick is the stick that is strung.

original: rgyud rten ni rgyud kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rgyud rten ni rgyud kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: The string is the main string.

original: dang po dang tha ma las sgra ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni bar ma dag tu 'ang sbyar ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po dang tha ma las sgra ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni bar ma dag tu 'ang sbyar ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “sound does not arise from the first or last” is meant to include the middle.

original: yang dag par dkrogs pa ni yang dag par rab tu bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dkrogs pa ni yang dag par rab tu bskyod pa'o //
translated: The correct shaking is the correct vibration.

original: snga bkong ba ni gzi byin nyams par byas ba'o //
analyzed: snga bkong ba ni gzi byin nyams par byas ba'o //
translated: The weakening is the loss of strength.

original: 'thor zhing zhes bya ba ni 'thor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thor zhing zhes bya ba ni 'thor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Scattered” means scattered about.

original: bar snang ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: bar snang ni nam mkha'o //
translated: “Space” means the sky.

original: bdag gi lus kyis chos 'phags mngon par bkab ste zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun du lus thams cad kyis sa la phab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyis chos 'phags mngon par bkab ste zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun du lus thams cad kyis sa la phab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Covered the noble Dharma with my body” means that he fell to the ground with his whole body in front of him.

original: de'i dus ji tsam gyi bar du zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dus ji tsam gyi bar du zhe na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: lo bdun gyi bar du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: lo bdun gyi bar du zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The text says “for seven years.”

original: dus 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pas so //
analyzed: dus 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni snyoms par zhugs pas so //
translated: “Passing the time” means that he was absorbed in meditation.

original: gang bdag kyang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bdag kyang ngo //
analyzed: gang bdag kyang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe bdag kyang ngo //
translated: “Whatever” means “when.”

original: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: “To follow” means to imitate.

original: lha'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
translated: “Divine” means “from the sky.”

original: sems gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba'i sa phyogs chag chag gdab pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan nyid du zhes bya ba'i sa phyogs chag chag gdab pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: “With a different mind” means “to turn one’s back on the sprinkling of the ground.”

original: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar nges par brtags nas so //
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar nges par brtags nas so //
translated: “Having thought in this way” means “having thus ascertained.”

original: de dag thams cad kyis kyang @226a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis kyang @226a * //
translated: All of them

original: zhes bya ba ni bu mo lnga brgya po dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bu mo lnga brgya po dag go //
translated: These are the five hundred girls.

original: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni mtshon gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni mtshon gyi khyad par ro //
translated: Those and those means the particular weapons.

original: glags ni skabs so //
analyzed: glags ni skabs so //
translated: Opportunity means occasion.

original: byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba ni byas pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba ni byas pa'o //
translated: Empowered means made.

original: 'dir dris khyab bo zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir dris khyab bo zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the question is asked: “Empowered by what?”

original: yongs su tshol pa ni kun du tshol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol pa ni kun du tshol ba'o //
translated: Searching is seeking.

original: 'phags pa chos 'phags chos ji lta bu ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos 'phags chos ji lta bu ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the noble Dharmodgata teach the Dharma?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “There, the bodhisattva mahāsattva…” and so on.

original: rtogs sla'o // 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rtogs sla'o // 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is easy to understand.🔽In the passage beginning with “For example…”

original: 'di lta ste'i sgras ni spyir bstan pa khyad par du bsal bar byed /
analyzed: 'di lta ste'i sgras ni spyir bstan pa khyad par du bsal bar byed /
translated: The word “for example” clarifies the general statement.

original: sum cu po 'di dag rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sum cu po 'di dag rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “these thirty aspects” is as follows.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la thob pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa sum cu pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la thob pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa sum cu pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, this is the thirtyfold arising by the power of attainment.

original: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ngu la skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ngu la skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: By these very aspects, the concentration that was born in the bodhisattva Perpetually Weeping is shown.

original: chos thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the sameness of all phenomena.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas te /
translated: Because all phenomena are sameness.

original: de ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pas de yang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pas de yang mnyam pa'o //
translated: That is also the sameness because it is without reference point in all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the isolation of all phenomena.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ben pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ben pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are isolation.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rnag gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dben pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rnag gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dben pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are isolated by the characteristic of their own nature,

original: gal te nam zhig na rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba 'di las g-yos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam zhig na rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba 'di las g-yos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: if one were to ask, “When will this appearance of one’s own characteristic be overturned?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa g-yo ba med pa nyid do zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The perfection of wisdom is without movement.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa ste /
translated: All dharmas are unmoving.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rnam par dben pas na g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rnam par dben pas na g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Because all dharmas are void, they are unmoving.

original: de bas na de yang rnam par dben pa las mi g-yo ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de yang rnam par dben pa las mi g-yo ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they do not move from voidness.

original: gal te slom sems kyis g-yos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te slom sems kyis g-yos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Do they move because of the mind’s movement? ”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rlom sems med pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rlom sems med pa nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The passage, “The perfection of wisdom is not a conceit” explains that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad rlom sems med pa nyid las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rlom sems med pa nyid las so //
translated: Because all dharmas are not conceits.

original: rlom sems med pa ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: rlom sems med pa ni chos thams cad de /
translated: All dharmas are not conceits.

original: de dag la ni rlom sems cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag la ni rlom sems cung zad kyang med de /
translated: They do not have even the slightest conceit.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are essenceless.

original: des na de la yang rlom sems @226b med do //
analyzed: des na de la yang rlom sems @226b med do //
translated: Therefore, they do not have even the slightest conceit.

original: gal te yang 'di ci zhig gis khengs par byas pas g-yo ba med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di ci zhig gis khengs par byas pas g-yo ba med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What is it that moves because it is inflated? ”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khengs pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khengs pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The passage, “The perfection of wisdom is not inflated” explains that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad khengs pa med pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad khengs pa med pas so //
translated: Because all phenomena are without arrogance.

original: chos thams cad dben pa las g-yo ba med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa las g-yo ba med de /
translated: All phenomena do not move from isolation.

original: gang gis kyang khengs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis kyang khengs pa med do //
translated: There is no one who is arrogant.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin kho nas dben par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin kho nas dben par gnas pa yin te /
translated: However, they naturally abide in isolation.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom abides in isolation.

original: dang por mnyam pa nyid tsam bstan gyi /
analyzed: dang por mnyam pa nyid tsam bstan gyi /
translated: First, just sameness is taught,

original: ro gcig pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par to gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: ro gcig pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par to gcig pa nyid de /
translated: but not the very same taste. Therefore, all phenomena are the very same taste as the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ro gcig pa nyid pas te /
translated: Because all phenomena are the very same taste.

original: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa yin te /
translated: All phenomena are the very same taste as suchness,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their own characteristics do not exist.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yod ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yod ste /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom exists,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its own characteristic does not appear.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is limitless,🔽because it is not apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mu med pa nyid pas te /
translated: Because all phenomena are limitless.

original: 'di ltar mu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu ni gnyis te /
translated: In this way, the limits are two:

original: sngon gyi mu dang / phyi ma'i mu'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mu dang / phyi ma'i mu'o //
translated: the prior limit and the posterior limit.

original: de dag med de chos thams cad kyi 'das pa dang // ma 'ong pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag med de chos thams cad kyi 'das pa dang // ma 'ong pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist because all phenomena are without past and future.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad mu med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad mu med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are limitless.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also so.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-arising.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa nyid pas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa nyid pas te /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-arising.

original: de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: That is the intrinsic realitylessness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir skye ba med de ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba med de ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising, like the horn of a donkey.

original: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no arising.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also so.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gag pa med pa nyid dang mu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'gag pa med pa nyid dang mu med pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is unceasing and limitless.

original: dpe gang gis she na nam mkha' mu med pas so //
analyzed: dpe gang gis she na nam mkha' mu med pas so //
translated: What is the example? Space is limitless.

original: de ltar na phyogs bcu 'am dus gsum du nam mkha' la mu med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs bcu 'am dus gsum du nam mkha' la mu med pa'o //
translated: Thus, space is limitless in the ten directions and the three times.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid tsam snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid tsam snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is limitless because it illuminates the suchness of all phenomena in the ten directions and three times.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mu med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mu med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is limitless,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi @227a * //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi @227a * //
translated: the world systems in the ten directions

original: khams kyang mu med na /
analyzed: khams kyang mu med na /
translated: are also limitless.🔽If the world systems in the ten directions are limitless,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho mu med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho mu med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: how much more so the limitless oceans in the world systems of the ten directions?

original: de bas na rgya mtsho mu med pa yang grub ste /
analyzed: de bas na rgya mtsho mu med pa yang grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the limitless oceans are established.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin yang ste /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also limitless.

original: 'di ltar gang rgya mtsho de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang rgya mtsho de dag gi de bzhin nyid dang / gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di ni gcig ste /
translated: Thus, the suchness of those oceans, the suchness of all phenomena, and the suchness of the perfection of wisdom are one.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the object of thusness.

original: de'i phyir rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the perfection of wisdom is boundless because the ocean is boundless.

original: rnam par shes pa yang rmi lam lta bu yin la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang nam mkha' lta bu yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang rmi lam lta bu yin la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang nam mkha' lta bu yin na /
translated: Consciousness is like a dream, and the perfection of wisdom is like space.

original: de sngar rnam pa sna tshogs su sangs ba dang / ji ltar don gcig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de sngar rnam pa sna tshogs su sangs ba dang / ji ltar don gcig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is purified in various aspects, how can it not be of one meaning?

original: de'i phyir ri rab sna tshogs nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri rab sna tshogs nyid yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the perfection of wisdom is various because Mount Sumeru is various.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du ri rab kyi ngos rnam pa sna tshogs su mu med kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du ri rab kyi ngos rnam pa sna tshogs su mu med kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: Just as space has the nature of one taste, so too Mount Sumeru appears in various aspects, although boundless in various aspects.

original: de bzhin nyid ni ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Thusness is of one taste.

original: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not of various kinds.

original: de bzhin nyid las dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The object of suchness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang yang smi lam la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos la kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang smi lam la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos la kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that appears in various aspects in dreams, etc., is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de'i phyir rmi la dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi la dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that is like a dream, an illusion, etc., is the superficial,

original: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i shes pa la sems can gzung par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i shes pa la sems can gzung par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is taught for the purpose of instructing sentient beings in the consciousness that is without appearance and ultimate.

original: yang na snang ba med pa'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang myong ba nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: yang na snang ba med pa'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang myong ba nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Or else, it is for the purpose of ascertaining the experience of the conceptual thought that arises after the absence of appearance.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the desired aim is accomplished.

original: ri rab sna tshogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ri rab sna tshogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because of the variety of Mount Meru, the perfection of wisdom is said to be of various kinds.

original: snang ba med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid rang gis myong ba na don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid rang gis myong ba na don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: When one experiences that perfection of wisdom which is non-appearance, one teaches that ultimately all things are of the nature of non-substantiality.

original: de ji @227b ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji @227b ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it non-conceptual?

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' rtog pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtog pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' rtog pa med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rtog pa med pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual, because space is non-conceptual.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog pa med pas de la rnam par rtog pa cung zad kyang med de pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rtog pa med pas de la rnam par rtog pa cung zad kyang med de pha rol tu phyin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual, it is not conceptual in the least, because it is a perfection.

original: gal te dper na blun pa nyid kyi phyir de ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dper na blun pa nyid kyi phyir de ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How is it non-conceptual, since it is like a fool?”

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' la dngos por rnam par rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' la dngos por rnam par rtog pa yin na /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If one conceptualizes space as a thing,🔽one conceptualizes the perfection of wisdom as a thing.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin blun pa ma yin na ji ltar rtog par mi byed can /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin blun pa ma yin na ji ltar rtog par mi byed can /
translated: If space is not a fool, how can it not conceptualize?

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: Here, conceptualization is error.

original: de ni 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that this is not error.

original: gzugs su med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs su med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not exist as form, the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' mu med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' mu med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po yang ngo //
translated: Just as space is limitless, so too is the aggregate of form.

original: gang yang gzugs las gzhan med pa de la nges par snang ba dang mun pa yang med do //
analyzed: gang yang gzugs las gzhan med pa de la nges par snang ba dang mun pa yang med do //
translated: And where there is nothing other than form, there is neither light nor darkness.

original: de bzhin du de'i de bzhin nyid snang ba na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i de bzhin nyid snang ba na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
translated: Likewise, when its suchness appears, the perfection of wisdom is limitless.

original: ji ltar bdag gis rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba mu med pa nyid dang / 'du shes mu med pa nyid dang 'du byed mu med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan sems can thams cad kyi tshor ba mu med pa nyid dang / 'du shes mu med pa nyid dang 'du byed mu med pa nyid dang /
translated: Just as I have explained the limitless perfection of wisdom through the limitlessness of the ocean, so too the limitlessness of the feelings of all other sentient beings, the limitlessness of perceptions, the limitlessness of formative factors, and the limitlessness of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa mu med pa nyid dang / sa'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / chu'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / me'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / rlung gi khams mu med pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams mu med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mu med pa nyid dang / sa'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / chu'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / me'i khams mu med pa nyid dang / rlung gi khams mu med pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams mu med pa nyid dang /
translated: the infinite nature of the wind element,🔽the infinite nature of the space element,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa nyid kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa nyid kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: and the infinite nature of the consciousness element should be explained.

original: ji ste gang rnam par shes pa'i phung po mu med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ci na /
analyzed: ji ste gang rnam par shes pa'i phung po mu med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mu med pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ci na /
translated: If the infinite nature of the aggregate of consciousness and the infinite nature of the consciousness element are the same, what is the difference between them?

original: phung po dang khams kyi sgra dag gis bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang khams kyi sgra dag gis bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: They are distinguished by the terms “aggregate” and “element.”

original: rdo rje sta bu'i chos mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje sta bu'i chos mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the Dharma of the vajra-like sameness, the perfection of wisdom is sameness.

original: sems 'dzin pas na chos te ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems 'dzin pas na chos te ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The Dharma is concentration, because it holds the mind.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i chos ni rdo rje lta bu'i @228a * //🔽ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i chos ni rdo rje lta bu'i @228a * //🔽ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The Dharma of the vajra is the vajra-like concentration.

original: de chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of all dharmas is the sameness of the perfection of wisdom, since all dharmas are like an illusion.

original: chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'dres pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma 'dres pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'dres pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The non-mixture of all dharmas is the non-mixture of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa nyid ni ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ma 'dres pa nyid ni ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: The non-mixture of all dharmas is non-mixture,

original: 'byed par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the specific characteristics that distinguish them do not exist.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma mu med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma mu med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung po yang ngo //
translated: Just as the perfection of wisdom is boundless, so too is the form aggregate.

original: gang yang gzugs las gzhan med pa de la nges par snang ba dang mun pa yang med do //
analyzed: gang yang gzugs las gzhan med pa de la nges par snang ba dang mun pa yang med do //
translated: And where there is no other than form, there is neither light nor darkness.

original: de bzhin du de'i de bzhin nyid snang ba na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i de bzhin nyid snang ba na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med pa nyid do //
translated: Likewise, when its suchness appears, the perfection of wisdom is boundless.

original: ji ltar bdag gis rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan sems shing 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis rgya mtsho mu med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan sems shing 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as I have explained the infinite perfection of wisdom by means of the infinite ocean, so also others should reflect on it, because it is not grasped.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is not an object of apprehension, nor is it an apprehender.

original: de'i phyir de dag dang de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang de mi dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not apprehended by them.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba la rnam par 'jig pa ni gzhan dag la tshig gis ston pa de chos thams cad la med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'jig pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya ba la rnam par 'jig pa ni gzhan dag la tshig gis ston pa de chos thams cad la med de /
translated: The equality of the destruction of all phenomena is the equality of the destruction of the perfection of wisdom. The destruction of all phenomena is the non-existence of the teaching of the Dharma to others through words.

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'jig pa med pas de dag mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'jig pa med pas de dag mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are equal because of the absence of destruction.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'jig pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa thams cad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'jig pa med pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the absence of destruction of the perfection of wisdom with regard to all objects of apprehension is equality.

original: chos thams cad byed pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byed pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa ni 'dir bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byed pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa ni 'dir bya ba ste /
translated: Since all dharmas are inactive, the perfection of wisdom is inactive.🔽Here, “inactive” means “without activity.”

original: chos thams cad bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bya ba med pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are without activity.

original: de ltar gang zhig ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can something arise in that way?

original: 'di yod pa'i rkyen gyis 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung la 'di med na ni 'di mi 'byung zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pa'i rkyen gyis 'di yod na ni 'di 'byung la 'di med na ni 'di mi 'byung zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: When this exists, because of the condition of this, that arises; when this does not exist, because of the absence of this, that does not arise.

original: de'i phyir 'di rnams ni byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rnams ni byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, these are inactive.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also inactive.

original: @228b chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @228b chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since all dharmas are inconceivable, the perfection of wisdom should be known as inconceivable.

original: ji ltar chos ni gzhan dag la bstan du med de /
analyzed: ji ltar chos ni gzhan dag la bstan du med de /
translated: How are dharmas not to be taught to others?

original: tshig gi yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of words does not exist.

original: de bzhin du rang gis kyang bsam du med cing brtag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gis kyang bsam du med cing brtag tu med pa ste /
translated: Likewise, it is also inconceivable and unappraisable by oneself,

original: de dag dang rnam par rtog pa dang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang rnam par rtog pa dang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are synonymous with conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom is inconceivable.

original: rigs par bya'o zhes gang mthar brjod pa de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshig dag la sbyar te /
analyzed: rigs par bya'o zhes gang mthar brjod pa de ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshig dag la sbyar te /
translated: One should understand is stated at the end, and that is applied to the words equality of all phenomena, etc.

original: med na mi 'byung pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not without a reason.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba las sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba las sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Then, the Lord said to the bodhisattva, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Then is the completion of the teaching.

original: de ltar 'dug bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i stan las ma langs pa ro //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dug bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i stan las ma langs pa ro // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Sitting there is not rising from the seat of hearing.🔽Then and so on is the teaching.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: At that time and so on is the explanation.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rim pa gang dang rnam pa gang nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i rim pa de nyid dang rnam pa de nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin su cu skyes so zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rim pa gang dang rnam pa gang nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i rim pa de nyid dang rnam pa de nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin su cu skyes so zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: At that time means at the time of the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, in the same order and in the same aspects, the concentrations were born. This is the condensed meaning.

original: de la chos thams cad mnyams pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin du yang bstan na /🔽ji ltar 'di dag rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad mnyams pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin du yang bstan na / ji ltar 'di dag rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therein, if the concentrations are taught by the aspect of the equality of all phenomena,🔽how are they aspects?

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis te /
translated: They are aspects by these aspects.

original: bzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
analyzed: bzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
translated: The four and the aspects of intuition

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: are called aspects, which are characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de lta mod kyi rang rang gi dmigs pa ni de nyid kyi gzhi ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rang rang gi dmigs pa ni de nyid kyi gzhi ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: However, each one has that very same basis as its object, just as it is.

original: yang na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa nyid dmigs pa ste /
translated: Or else, the equality of all phenomena, etc. are the objects.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Because their objects are the objects of those concentrations, they are called that.

original: gzhi la gnas pa mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa ni rang rang gi ji lta ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi la gnas pa mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa ni rang rang gi ji lta ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The signless, etc. , which are based on the ground, are the individual forms of each.

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sum cu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin sum cu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “etc.” includes the thirty meditative stabilizations, etc.

original: ji ltar de dag la sogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag la sogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they included?

original: 'di dag nyid kyis lhag ma bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis lhag ma bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are included in the remaining perfections.

original: brgya phrag stong zhes bya ba ni 'dum mo //🔽chos 'phags kyis mtshon pa'i le'u ni de'i @229a * //
analyzed: brgya phrag stong zhes bya ba ni 'dum mo // chos 'phags kyis mtshon pa'i le'u ni de'i @229a * //
translated: “ Hundreds of thousands” is a round number.🔽The chapter that illustrates the noble perfection of wisdom is the chapter of that name.

original: le'u'o // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o /
analyzed: le'u'o // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u sum cu rtsa gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the thirty-first chapter, “The Chapter of the Illustration of the Noble Perfection of Wisdom,” in the Ornament of the Essence, a commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / thob ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dis thos pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi phan yon de'i dus su skyes pa ni de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag pa'i sgras ni dus mnyam du thob po zhes brjod de /
analyzed: // / thob ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dis thos pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi phan yon de'i dus su skyes pa ni de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag pa'i sgras ni dus mnyam du thob po zhes brjod de /
translated: Immediately upon attaining, etc. This is the benefit of the concentrations of learning that arises at that time. Because of that, the word immediately indicates that they are attained simultaneously.

original: thob pa yod na'o //
analyzed: thob pa yod na'o //
translated: If there is attainment,

original: tshul 'di lta bu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi dngos pos so //
analyzed: tshul 'di lta bu nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi dngos pos so //
translated: By this very method, by the reality of the eight realizations as explained.

original: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pas so //
translated: By this very name, by the knowledge of all aspects, etc.

original: gar skyes pa thams cad du sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gar skyes pa thams cad du sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Wherever he is born, he will never be separated from the Buddha. This is the teaching.

original: 'di ni 'og tu bstan pa'i gzhung las 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og tu bstan pa'i gzhung las 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained from the text below, up to he will never be separated.

original: des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su gtad pa'i gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su gtad pa'i gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: By this, etc. is the introduction to the entrustment.

original: des rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni rtag tu ngu'i ji ltar byung pas kyang ngo //🔽kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des rnam grangs 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni rtag tu ngu'i ji ltar byung pas kyang ngo // kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: By this method means by the method of Sadaprarudita.

original: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go zhes bya ba'i bar ni gtad pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go zhes bya ba'i bar ni gtad pa dang po'o //
translated: Therefore, Ananda, etc., up to this is my instruction is the first entrusting.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'i tshig ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'i tshig ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Here, why is the phrase the Tathagata's blessing used?

original: don chen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don chen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has great meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das yum la bar du gcod pa ni mang du yod pas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs med par bri bar yang mi nus so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum la bar du gcod pa ni mang du yod pas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs med par bri bar yang mi nus so zhes bstan to //
translated: Since there are many obstacles to the Bhagavat's Mother, it is taught that without the Buddha's blessing, it cannot be written.

original: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go zhes bya ba la 'di ni nga'i gtad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i gdams ngag go zhes bya ba la 'di ni nga'i gtad pa ste /
translated: This is my instruction means this is my entrusting.

original: ji ltar 'di nyan pa la sogs pas rgyun mi 'chad par de ltar khyod kyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyan pa la sogs pas rgyun mi 'chad par de ltar khyod kyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means You should act so that it is uninterrupted by listening to it, etc., in this way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de yongs su gtad pa la dgos pa ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de yongs su gtad pa la dgos pa ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is that? means “What is the purpose of that entrustment?”

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “From this perfection of wisdom…” and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtad pa @229b gnyis pa'i gleng ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtad pa @229b gnyis pa'i gleng ba'o //
translated: “Why is that?” and so on is the introduction to the second entrustment.

original: gnas pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni sku 'di la'o //
analyzed: gnas pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni sku 'di la'o //
translated: “In this life” means in this body.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa 'di dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa 'di dag go //
translated: “Likewise” means these joys and so on.

original: gleng bslang ba 'di dag byas nas yongs su gtad pa'i phyir kun dga' po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gleng bslang ba 'di dag byas nas yongs su gtad pa'i phyir kun dga' po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having made these introductions, in order to entrust it, it is said, “Ānanda…” and so on.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba la yongs su gtad do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gtad pa'o //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba la yongs su gtad do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gtad pa'o //
translated: “Twice, three times” and so on means “entrusts” is the correct entrustment.

original: rjes su yongs su gtad do zhes bya ba ni mthun par yongs su gtad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yongs su gtad do zhes bya ba ni mthun par yongs su gtad pa'o //
translated: “Entrusts again and again” is the compatible entrustment.

original: ji ltar yongs su gtad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su gtad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it entrusted?

original: de'i phyir ci nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ci nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in every way, etc.”

original: skyes bu tha ma zhes bya ba ni ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu tha ma zhes bya ba ni ma gus pa'o //
translated: The “inferior person” is the one who is disrespectful.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la dga' ba dang gus par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la dga' ba dang gus par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one delight in and respect this?

original: de'i phyir du dga' bo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir du dga' bo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Ānanda, whoever delights in the perfection of wisdom, etc.,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung ni spyod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung ni spyod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: up to should know that he is practicing in the presence of the Tathāgata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das yum yongs su rdzogs par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir sdud pa pos bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum yongs su rdzogs par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir sdud pa pos bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to clarify the complete Mother of the Victor, the compiler says, “Blessed One, etc.”

original: de skad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'o //
translated: “Thus” refers to the Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra.

original: bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Having spoken” means having taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni ston pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the teacher.

original: gzhan gyi don la dgyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la dgyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is the one who delights in the welfare of others.

original: gzan gyi don mchog tu mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzan gyi don mchog tu mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One taught the supreme meaning of the robe.

original: de'i phyir yi rangs te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yi rangs te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, they rejoiced.

original: bla na med pa'i chos bstan pas dga' par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos bstan pas dga' par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they were delighted by the teaching of the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: nyan pa pos ci zhig byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyan pa pos ci zhig byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: What did the listeners do?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, they praised what the Blessed One said.

original: bstod pa'i sngon rol du mngon par 'brel pa ni las dang bcas pa yin te /🔽de ni la lar ni 'dod pa la 'jug la /
analyzed: bstod pa'i sngon rol du mngon par 'brel pa ni las dang bcas pa yin te / de ni la lar ni 'dod pa la 'jug la /
translated: The connection before the praise is with the action.🔽That is sometimes engaged in desire,

original: la lar ni dga' ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: la lar ni dga' ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: and sometimes in delight.

original: de la dmigs pa nyid ni @230a * //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid ni @230a * //
translated: Here, the object is

original: 'dir las yin te las de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bstan pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir las yin te las de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bstan pa 'di nyid do //
translated: the action. And that action is precisely this teaching spoken by the Blessed One.

original: nyan pa po dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyan pa po dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Who are the listeners?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and so on.

original: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi tshogs so //
translated: The world is the assembly of beings.

original: nyan pa po dag kyang rgyal po'i khab kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir mi'i tshogs so //
analyzed: nyan pa po dag kyang rgyal po'i khab kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir mi'i tshogs so //
translated: The listeners are also a group of humans, because this is the context of Rājagṛha.

original: 'di 'ba' zhig gis rtog pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir khyad par du byas pa ni lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig gis rtog pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir khyad par du byas pa ni lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is distinguished from the others in order to eliminate any doubts, and so it is said that the assembly included gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang / lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten zhes bsdus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang / lha la sogs pa'i 'jig rten zhes bsdus so //
translated: This includes the world of bodhisattvas and the world of gods and so forth.

original: yongs su gtad pa brjod pa'i le'u ni yongs su gtad pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa brjod pa'i le'u ni yongs su gtad pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that describes the entrustment is the chapter on the entrustment.

original: 'khrul pa'i dri ma sna tshogs rnam bral gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dri ma sna tshogs rnam bral gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: Free from the various stains of delusion, free from the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: 'gro ba gang dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig de ni rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig de ni rnam par mdzes //
translated: The beings who are of one taste with suchness are beautiful.

original: rnam rtog las sgrol shes rab pa rol phyin de byang chub sems dpa'i blo //
analyzed: rnam rtog las sgrol shes rab pa rol phyin de byang chub sems dpa'i blo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that liberates from conceptuality is the bodhisattva’s mind.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa'i thar phyin dpa' po de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa'i thar phyin dpa' po de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod //
translated: That very pure perfection of liberation is called the tathāgata.

original: gang zhig mngon rtogs brgyad dang stong phrag brgyad du bstan pa yi //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon rtogs brgyad dang stong phrag brgyad du bstan pa yi //
translated: May the mass of merit that I have gained by this analysis of the causes and sutras

original: rgyu dang mdo ni bdag gis rnam phyes thob pa'i bsod nams kyi //
analyzed: rgyu dang mdo ni bdag gis rnam phyes thob pa'i bsod nams kyi //
translated: of the eight clear realizations and the eight thousand,

original: phung po'i 'bras bu des ni skyed ci rigs grol gyur cig //
analyzed: phung po'i 'bras bu des ni skyed ci rigs grol gyur cig //
translated: by that fruit of the mass of merit, may all beings be freed in whatever way is appropriate.

original: bdag kyang sna tshogs bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dbang thob shog //
analyzed: bdag kyang sna tshogs bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dbang thob shog //
translated: May I also obtain power over the uninterrupted performance of various actions.

original: ji srid 'dir ni mar me'i snying po chen po rdzogs yod gyur //
analyzed: ji srid 'dir ni mar me'i snying po chen po rdzogs yod gyur //
translated: For as long as the great wick of this lamp exists here,

original: skye kho rnams kyi yid kyi nang der snang ba 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: skye kho rnams kyi yid kyi nang der snang ba 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: may the light of the Dharma arise in the minds of all beings.

original: yon tan dpe med ston cing ma lus dri med bsngags pa yin / goo ta ma'i gsung des srid pa'i mun pa sel gyur cig //
analyzed: yon tan dpe med ston cing ma lus dri med bsngags pa yin / goo ta ma'i gsung des srid pa'i mun pa sel gyur cig //
translated: May the darkness of existence be dispelled by the words of Gautama, which reveal incomparable qualities and are praised as completely stainless.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin bsdus pa //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin bsdus pa //
translated: The Compendium of the Perfection of Wisdom

original: brgya phrag bcu pa brgyad dag gi //
analyzed: brgya phrag bcu pa brgyad dag gi //
translated: In one hundred and eight chapters,

original: dka' 'grel snying po mchog ces pa //
analyzed: dka' 'grel snying po mchog ces pa //
translated: The commentary called Essence of the Middle Way

original: tshig gsal 'di ni bdag gis byas //
analyzed: tshig gsal 'di ni bdag gis byas //
translated: This Clear Words was composed by me.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel la snying po mchog ces bya ba rgyal po'i slob dbon mkhas pa chen po rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel la snying po mchog ces bya ba rgyal po'i slob dbon mkhas pa chen po rin chen 'byung gnas zhi ba'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in 8,000 Lines called “The Essence of the Middle Way” was composed by the great scholar-king’s preceptor, the venerable Ratnākaraśānti. It is complete.
